    <dl>
           <dt>ka 1</dt>
           <dd><em>ka</em> the first consonant of the alphabet, and the first guttural letter (corresponding in sound to <em>k</em> in <em>keep</em> or <em>king</em>)</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kak&#x0101;ra </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;k&#x0101;ra</em> m. the letter or sound <em>ka</em> TPr&#x0101;t</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kavat </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;vat</em> mfn. having the word <em>ka</em> NBD</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kavarga </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;varga</em> m. the gutturals (of which <em>ka</em> is the first letter) TPr&#x0101;t. Siddh. (cf. <em>varg&#x00e1;</em>.)</dd>

           <dt>ka 2</dt>
           <dd><em>k&#x00e1;</em> <em>kas</em>, <em>k&#x0101;</em>, <em>kim</em>, interrog. pron. ( <em>kim</em> and 2. <em>kad</em>, and <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#the">the.</a> following words in which the interrogative base <em>ka</em> appears, <em>katama</em>, <em>katara</em>, <em>kati</em>, <em>katham</em>, <em>kad&#x0101;</em>, <em>karhi</em>, <em>k&#x0101;</em>, &amp;c.), who? which? what? In its declension <em>ka</em> follows the pronoun <em>tad</em> except in nom. acc. sing. neut., where <em>kim</em> has taken the place of <em>kad</em> or <em>kat</em> in classical Sansk&#x1e5b;it </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; but the old form <em>kad</em> is found in the Veda ( Gram. 227) ; [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Zd">Zd.</a> <em>ka</em>, <em>k&#x00f4;</em>, <em>k&#x00e2;</em>, <em>kat</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Gk. ?, ?, (Ion. ?, ?,) ?, ? ; Lat. <em>quis</em>, [240, 2] <em>quid</em> ; Lith. <em>kas</em> <em>k&#x00e1;</em> ; Goth. <em>hvas</em>, <em>hv&#x00f4;</em>, <em>hva</em>, Angl. Sax. <em>hw&#x0101;</em>, <em>hwaet</em> ; Eng. <em>who</em>, <em>what</em>.] The interrogative sentence introduced by <em>ka</em> is often terminated by <em>iti</em> (e.g. <em>kasya sa putra iti kathyat&#x0101;m</em>, let it be said, 'whose son is he?'), but <em>iti</em> may be omitted and the sentence lose its direct interrogative character (e.g. <em>kasya sa putro na j&#x00f1;&#x0101;yate</em>, it is not known whose son he is). <em>ka</em> with or without &#x221a;1. <em>as</em> may express 'how is it possible that?' 'what power have I, you, they, &amp;c.?' (e.g. <em>ke mama dhanvino'nye</em>, what can the other archers do against me? <em>ke &#x0101;v&#x0101;m paritr&#x0101;tum</em>, what power have we to rescue you?) <em>ka</em> is often connected with a demonstrative pron. (e.g. <em>ko'yam &#x0101;y&#x0101;ti</em>, who comes here?) or with the potential (e.g. <em>ko hari&#x1e43; nindet</em>, who will blame Hari?) <em>ka</em> is sometimes repeated (e.g. <em>ka&#x1e25; ko'tra</em>, who is there? <em>k&#x0101;n k&#x0101;n</em>, whom? whom? i.e. which of them? <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Gram">Gram.</a> 54), and the repetition is often due to a kind of attraction (e.g. <em>ke&#x1e63;&#x0101;&#x1e43; ki&#x1e43; &#x015b;&#x0101;stram adhyayan&#x012b;yam</em>, which book is to be read by whom? Gram. 836. <em>a</em>). When <em>kim</em> is connected with the inst. c. of a noun or with the indecl. participle it may express 'what is gained by doing so, &amp;c.?' (= <em>ko'rthas</em>) <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p240-3"></a>[Page 240, Column 3]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (e.g. <em>ki&#x1e43; vilambena</em>, what is gained by delay? <em>kim bahun&#x0101;</em>, what is the use of more words? <em>dhanena ki&#x1e43; yo na dad&#x0101;ti</em>, what is the use of wealth to him who does not give? with inst. and gen., <em>n&#x012b;ruja&#x1e25; kim au&#x1e63;adhai&#x1e25;</em>, what is the use of medicine to the healthy?) <em>ka</em> is often followed by the particles <em>iva</em>, <em>u</em>, <em>n&#x0101;ma</em>, <em>nu</em>, <em>v&#x0101;</em>, <em>svid</em>, some of which serve merely to generalize the interrogation (e.g. <em>kim iva etad</em>, what can this be? <em>ka u &#x015b;ravat</em>, who can possibly hear? <em>ko n&#x0101;ma j&#x0101;n&#x0101;ti</em>, who indeed knows? <em>ko nv ayam</em>, who, pray, is this? <em>ki&#x1e43; nu k&#x0101;ryam</em>, what is to be done? <em>ko v&#x0101; dev&#x0101;d anya&#x1e25;</em>, who possibly other than a god? <em>kasya svid h&#x1e5b;daya&#x1e43; n&#x00e2;sti</em>, of what person is there no heart?) <em>ka</em> is occasionally used alone as an indefinite pronoun, especially in negative sentences (e.g. <em>na kasya ko vallabha&#x1e25;</em>, no one is a favourite of any one </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>n&#x00e2;nyo j&#x0101;n&#x0101;ti ka&#x1e25;</em>, no one else knows </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>katha&#x1e43; sa gh&#x0101;tayati kam</em>, how does he kill any one?) Generally, however, <em>ka</em> is only made indefinite when connected with the particles <em>ca</em>, <em>can&#x00e1;</em>, <em>cid</em>, <em>v&#x0101;</em>, and <em>&#x00e1;pi</em>, in which case <em>ka</em> may sometimes be preceded by the relative <em>ya</em> (e.g. <em>ye ke ca</em>, any persons whatsoever </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>yasyai kasyai ca devat&#x0101;yai</em>, to any deity whatsoever </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>y&#x0101;ni k&#x0101;ni ca mitr&#x0101;&#x1e47;i</em>, any friends whatsoever </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>yat ki&#x1e43;ca</em>, whatever). The particle <em>cana</em>, being composed of <em>ca</em> and <em>na</em>, properly gives a negative force to the pronoun (e.g. <em>yasm&#x0101;d indr&#x0101;d &#x1e5b;te ki&#x1e43;cana</em>, without which Indra there is nothing), but the negative sense is generally dropped (e.g. <em>ka&#x015b;cana</em>, any one </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>na ka&#x015b;cana</em>, no one), and a relative is sometimes connected with it (e.g. <em>yat ki&#x1e43;cana</em>, anything whatsoever). Examples of <em>cid</em> with the interrogative are common </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>v&#x0101;</em> and <em>api</em> are not so common, but the latter is often found in classical Sansk&#x1e5b;it (e.g. <em>ka&#x015b;cid</em>, any one </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kecid</em>, some </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>na ka&#x015b;cid</em>, no one </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>na ki&#x1e43;cid api</em>, nothing whatsoever </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ya&#x1e25; ka&#x015b;cid</em>, any one whatsoever </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kecit</em> - <em>kecit</em>, some - others </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>yasmin kasmin v&#x0101; de&#x015b;e</em>, in any country whatsoever </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>na ko'pi</em>, no one </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>na kimapi</em>, nothing whatever). <em>ka</em> may sometimes be used, like 2. <em>kad</em>, at the beginning of a compound. <em>ka-p&#x016b;ya</em>, &amp;c</dd>

           <dt>ka 3</dt>
           <dd><em>k&#x00e1;</em> m. (according to native authorities) N. of Praj&#x0101;pati or of a Praj&#x0101;pati VS. xx, 4 ; xxii, 20 TS. i &#x015a;Br. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of Brahman MBh. i, 32 BhP. iii, 12, 51 ; xii, 13, 19 ; 20 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of Daksha BhP. ix, 10, 10 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of Vish&#x1e47;u L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of Yama L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of Garu&#x1e0d;a </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the soul Tattvas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a particular comet VarB&#x1e5b;S </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the sun L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fire L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; splendour, light L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; air L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a peacock L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the body L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; time L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; wealth L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sound L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a king L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>k&#x0101;ma-granthi</em> (?) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), n. happiness, joy, pleasure ChUp. iv, 10, 5 Nir. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; water MaitrS. i, 10, 10 &#x015a;Br. x Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the head </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; hair, a head of hair L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (also regarded as ind </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#1">1.</a> <em>kam</em>.)</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kaja </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;ja</em> mfn. produced in or by water, watery, aquatic </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), n. a lotus AgP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-"&#x1e63;&#x00e2;sana</em> m. 'sitting on a lotus', N. of Brahm&#x0101; Hcat</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kada </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;da</em> m. 'water-giver', a cloud L</dd>

           <dt>ka 4</dt>
           <dd><em>ka</em> a Taddhita affix (much used in forming adjectives </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; it may also be added to nouns to express diminution, deterioration, or similarity, e.g. <em>putraka</em>, a little son </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>a&#x015b;vaka</em>, a bad horse or like a horse)</dd>

           <dt>ka&#x1e43;ya </dt>
           <dd><em>ka&#x1e43;ya</em> &amp;c. 1. <em>kam</em>. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p241-1"></a>[Page 241, Column 1]</font>
</dd>

           <dt>ka&#x1e43;v&#x016b;la </dt>
           <dd><em>ka&#x1e43;v&#x016b;la</em> n. (in astrol.) N. of the eighth Yoga, = Arabic ?</dd>

           <dt>ka&#x1e43;&#x015b;a </dt>
           <dd><em>ka&#x1e43;&#x015b;&#x00e1;</em> = <em>ka&#x1e43;s&#x00e1;</em> below</dd>

           <dt>ka&#x1e43;s </dt>
           <dd><em>ka&#x1e43;s</em> cl. 2. &#x0100;. <em>ka&#x1e43;ste</em>, <em>caka&#x1e43;se</em>, <em>ka&#x1e43;sit&#x0101;</em>, &amp;c., to go </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to command </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to destroy Dh&#x0101;tup. xxiv, 14</dd>

           <dt>ka&#x1e43;sa </dt>
           <dd><em>ka&#x1e43;s&#x00e1;</em> <em>as</em>, <em>am</em> m. n. (&#x221a;<em>kam</em> U&#x1e47;. iii, 62), a vessel made of metal, drinking vessel, cup, goblet AV. x, 10, 5 AitBr. &#x015a;Br. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (a noun ending in <em>as</em> followed by <em>ka&#x1e43;sa</em> in a compound does not change its final, cf. <em>ayas-ka&#x1e43;sa</em>, &amp;c. P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 8-, 3, 46) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a particular measure (= two &#x0100;&#x1e0d;hakas Car </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = one &#x0100;&#x1e0d;haka L.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a metal, tutanag or white copper, brass, bell-metal </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. N. of a king of Mathur&#x0101; (son of Ugra-sena and cousin of the Devak&#x012b; who was mother of K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a [Ugra-sena being brother of Devaka, who was father of Devak&#x012b;] ; he is usually called the uncle, but was really a cousin of K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a, and became his implacable enemy because it had been prophesied to Ka&#x1e43;sa that he would be killed by a child of Devak&#x012b; ; as the foe of the deity he is identified with the Asura K&#x0101;lanemi ; and, as he was ultimately slain by K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a, the latter receives epithets like <em>ka&#x1e43;sa-jit</em>, conqueror of Ka&#x1e43;sa, &amp;c.) MBh. VP. BhP. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a place, g. <em>tak&#x1e63;a&#x015b;il&#x00e2;di</em> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 4-3, 93 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. N. of a sister of Ka&#x1e43;sa Hariv. BhP. VP</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ka&#x1e43;sak&#x0101;ra </dt>

           <dt>kakutsala </dt>
           <dd><em>kakutsala</em> n. (perhaps) an expression of endearment applied to a child <em>B&#x1e5b;&#x1e0d;.</em> AV. xviii, 4, 66, (= <em>kakut-sthala</em>, <em>j&#x0101;mayo nav&#x00f4;&#x1e0d;h&#x0101;&#x1e25; kakut-sthalam vastre&#x1e47;a yath&#x00f4;r&#x1e47;uvanti tath&#x00e2;iva mana &#x0101;cch&#x0101;daya</em>, <em>ity-artha&#x1e25;</em> T.) <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p241-2"></a>[Page 241, Column 2]</font>
</dd>

           <dt>kakutstha </dt>
           <dd><em>kakut-stha</em> below</dd>

           <dt>kakud </dt>
           <dd><em>kak&#x00fa;d</em> <em>t</em> f. a peak or summit (Lat. <em>cacumen</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; chief, head RV. viii, 44, 16 AV. vi, 86, 3 TS. &#x015a;Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; any projecting corner or projection (as of a plough) BhP. v, 25, 7 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the hump on the shoulders of the Indian bullock AV. TS. BhP. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the hump (of a man) Kath&#x0101;s </dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ka&#x1e47;vaveda </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;veda</em> m. N. of wk</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ka&#x1e47;vasakhi </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;sakhi</em> <em>&#x0101;</em> m. having the Ka&#x1e47;vas as friends, friendly disposed to them RV. x, 115, 5</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ka&#x1e47;vas&#x016b;tra </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;s&#x016b;tra</em> n. N. of wk</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ka&#x1e47;vahot&#x1e5b; </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;hot&#x1e5b;</em> mfn. one whose Hot&#x1e5b;i priest is a Ka&#x1e47;va RV. v, 41, 4</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ka&#x1e47;v&#x0101;di </dt>
           <dd><em>ka&#x1e47;v&#x00e2;di</em> m. N. of a ga&#x1e47;a P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 4-2, 111</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ka&#x1e47;v&#x0101;&#x015b;rama </dt>
           <dd><em>ka&#x1e47;v&#x00e2;&#x015b;rama</em> m. N. of a T&#x012b;rtha Vish&#x1e47;us</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ka&#x1e47;vopani&#x1e63;ad </dt>
           <dd><em>ka&#x1e47;v&#x00f4;pani&#x1e63;ad</em> f. N. of an Upanishad</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; ka&#x1e47;v&#x0101;ya </dt>
           <dd><em>ka&#x1e47;v&#x0101;ya</em> Nom. &#x0100;. <em>ka&#x1e47;v&#x0101;yate</em>, to do mischief (cf. <em>ka&#x1e47;va</em> n.) P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 3-1, 17</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; ka&#x1e47;v&#x012b;ya </dt>
           <dd><em>ka&#x1e47;v&#x012b;ya</em> mfn. relating to or performed by Ka&#x1e47;va</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ka&#x1e47;v&#x012b;yasa&#x1e43;hit&#x0101;homa </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;sa&#x1e43;hit&#x0101;-homa</em> m. N. of wk</dd>

           <dt>kata </dt>
           <dd><em>kata</em> m. Strychnos Potatorum (cf. the next) L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a &#x1e5a;ishi P&#x0101;&#x1e47;</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kataphala </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;phala</em> n. = the next</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kataka </dt>
           <dd><em>kataka</em> m. Strychnos Potatorum or the clearing nut plant (its seeds rubbed upon the inside of water-jars precipitate the earthy particles in the water W.) Mn. vi, 67 Su&#x015b;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a commentator on the R&#x0101;m&#x0101;ya&#x1e47;a</dd>

           <dt>katama </dt>
           <dd><em>katam&#x00e1;</em> <em>as</em>, <em>&#x0101;</em>, <em>at</em> mfn. (superlative of 2. <em>ka</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; declined as a pronom., Gram. 236), who or which of many? (e.g. <em>katamena path&#x0101; y&#x0101;t&#x0101;s te</em>, by which road have they gone?) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; it is often a mere strengthened substitute for <em>ka</em>, the superlative affix imparting emphasis </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; hence it may occasionally be used for 'who or which of two?' (e.g. <em>tayo&#x1e25; katamasmai</em>, to which of these two?) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; it may optionally be compounded with the word to which it refers (e.g. <em>katama&#x1e25; ka&#x1e6d;ha&#x1e25;</em>, or <em>katama-ka&#x1e6d;ha&#x1e25;</em>, which Ka&#x1e6d;ha out of many?) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; when followed by <em>ca</em> and preceded <em>yatama</em> an indefinite expression is formed equivalent to 'any whosoever', 'any whatsoever', &amp;c. (e.g. <em>yatamad eva katamac ca vidy&#x0101;t</em> he may know anything whatsoever). In negative sentences <em>katama</em> with <em>cana</em> or <em>katama</em> with <em>api</em> = not even one, none at all (e.g. <em>na katamaccan&#x00e2;ha&#x1e25;</em>, not even on a single day, on no day at all) <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p246-3"></a>[Page 246, Column 3]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in addition to the above uses <em>katama</em> is said to mean 'best', 'excessively good-looking' (cf. 3. <em>ka</em>) RV. &amp;c</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; katamoraga </dt>
           <dd><em>katam&#x00f4;raga</em> m. N. of a man</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; katara </dt>
           <dd><em>katar&#x00e1;</em> <em>as</em>, <em>&#x0101;</em>, <em>at</em> mfn. (comparative of 2. <em>ka</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; declined as a pronom., Gram. 236), who or which of two? whether of two? Analogously to <em>katama</em> above <em>katara</em> may occasionally be used to express 'who or which of many?' (e.g. <em>katarasy&#x0101;&#x1e43; di&#x015b;i</em>, in which quarter?), and may optionally be compounded with the word to which it refers (e.g. <em>katara&#x1e25; ka&#x1e6d;ha&#x1e25;</em> or <em>katara-ka&#x1e6d;ha&#x1e25;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in negative sentences <em>katara</em> with <em>cana</em> = neither of the two (e.g. <em>na katara&#x015b;-cana jigye</em>), neither of the two was conquered RV. &amp;c. ; [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Zd">Zd.</a> <em>kat&#x0101;ra</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Gk. ?, ? ; Goth. <em>hvathar</em> ; Eng. [246, 3] <em>whether</em> ; Lat. <em>uter</em> ; Old Germ. <em>huedar</em> ; Slav. <em>kotoryi</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kataratas </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;tas</em> ind. on which of the two sides? &#x015a;Br. vi</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kati 1</dt>
           <dd><em>k&#x00e1;ti</em> (fr. 2. <em>ka</em> declined in pl. only, Gram. 227 <em>a</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; all the cases except the nom. voc. and acc. taking terminations, whereas the correlative <em>iti</em> has become fixed as an indeclinable adverb), how many? <em>quot</em>? several (e.g. <em>kati dev&#x0101;&#x1e25;</em>, how many gods? <em>kati vy&#x0101;p&#x0101;dayati kati v&#x0101; t&#x0101;&#x1e0d;ayati</em>, some he kills and some he strikes). In the sense of 'several', 'some', <em>kati</em> is generally followed by <em>cid</em> or <em>api</em> (e.g. <em>katicid ah&#x0101;ni</em>, for several or some days) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; it may be used as an adverb with <em>cid</em> in the sense of 'oftentimes', 'much', in many ways' (e.g. <em>katicit stuta&#x1e25;</em>, much or often praised) RV. &amp;c. ; [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Zd">Zd.</a> <em>caiti</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Gk. ? ; Lat. <em>quot</em> ; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Sk">Sk.</a> <em>tati</em> and [246, 3] Lat. <em>tot</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; katik&#x1e5b;tvas </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;k&#x1e5b;tvas</em> ind. how many times? Vop. (cf. <em>k&#x00e1;ti</em>, <em>k&#x1e5b;&#x0301;tvas</em> &#x015a;Br. xii, 3, 2, 7.)</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; katibheda </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;bheda</em> mfn. of how many divisions or kinds? Car</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; katividha </dt>

           <dt>&#x226b; katititha </dt>

           <dt>&#x226b; katitha </dt>
           <dd><em>katith&#x00e1;</em> mfn. the how-maniest? P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 5-2, 51 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>cid</em>, the so-maniest RV. x, 61, 18 (= <em>katipay&#x0101;n&#x0101;&#x1e43; p&#x016b;ra&#x1e47;a&#x1e25;</em> S&#x0101;y.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to such and such a point </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Gk">Gk.</a> [246, 3] ? ; Lat. <em>quotus</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; katidh&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>katidh&#x0101;&#x0341;</em> ind. how many times? how often? in how many places? in how many parts? RV. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>cid</em>, everywhere RV. i, 31, 2</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; katipaya </dt>
           <dd><em>katipay&#x00e1;</em> mf(<em>&#x012b;</em>, <em>&#x0101;</em> [only BhP. ix, 18, 39])n. (m. pl. <em>e</em> and <em>&#x0101;s</em>) several, some </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a certain number, so many (e.g. <em>katipayen&#x00e2;har-ga&#x1e47;ena</em>, after some days </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also <em>katipayair ahobhi&#x1e25;</em>, <em>katipay&#x00e2;hasya</em>, &amp;c.) &#x015a;Br. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), n. a little, some (at the end of Tatpurusha compounds, e.g. <em>uda&#x015b;vit-katipayam</em>, a little Uda&#x015b;vit) P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 2-1, 65 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>ena</em> or <em>&#x0101;t</em>), ind. with some exertion, with difficulty, narrowly P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 2-3, 33</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; katipayatha </dt>

           <dt>kath </dt>
           <dd><em>kath</em> cl. 10. P. (ep. also &#x0100;.) <em>kathayati</em> (<em>-te</em>), aor. <em>acakathat</em> (P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 7-4, 93 K&#x0101;&#x015b;.) and <em>ac&#x012b;kathat</em> (Vop.), to converse with any one (instr., sometimes with <em>saha</em>) MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to tell, relate, narrate, report, inform, speak about, declare, explain, describe (with acc. of the thing or person spoken about) MBh. R. &#x015a;ak. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to announce, show, exhibit, bespeak, betoken Mn. xi, 114 &#x015a;ak. 291, 4 Su&#x015b;r. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to order, command Pa&#x00f1;cat. 57, 22 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to suppose, state MBh. iii, 10668 Mn. vii, 157: Pass. <em>kathyate</em>, to be called, be regarded or considered as, pass for Pa&#x00f1;cat. Hit. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; [fr. <em>katham</em>, 'to tell the how' ; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Goth">Goth.</a> <em>qvith4an</em> ; Old High Germ. <em>quethan</em> and <em>quedan</em> ; Eng. <em>quoth</em> and <em>quote</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kathaka </dt>

           <dd>&#x2022; the speaker of a prologue or monologue, chief actor L </dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kath&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>kath&#x0101;</em> (for 2. col. 3), f. conversation, speech, talking together &#x0100;&#x015b;vG&#x1e5b;. MBh. Mn. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; talk, mention </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>k&#x0101; kath&#x0101;</em> [with gen. or more commonly with loc. and sometimes with <em>prati</em>), what should one say of? how should one speak of? e.g. <em>eko'pi k&#x1e5b;cchr&#x0101;d varteta bh&#x016b;yas&#x0101;&#x1e43; tu kath&#x00e2;iva k&#x0101;</em>, even one person would live with difficulty, what should one say of many? i.e. how much more many? Kath&#x0101;s. iv, 123 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>k&#x0101; kath&#x0101; b&#x0101;&#x1e47;a-sa&#x1e43;dh&#x0101;ne</em>, what mention of fitting the arrow? i.e. what necessity for fitting the arrow? &#x015a;ak. 53 a) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; story, tale, fable MBh. R. Hit. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a feigned story, tale (as one, of the species of poetical composition) S&#x0101;h. 567 K&#x0101;vy&#x00e2;d </dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kath&#x0101;m&#x0101;tra </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;m&#x0101;tra</em> n. a mere story, nothing but a narrative </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (mfn.) one of whom nothing but the narrative is left, i.e. deceased, dead BhP. xii, 2, 44 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-"&#x1e63;tr&#x00e2;va&#x015b;i&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;a</em> mfn. id. BhP. xii, 2, 36 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-"&#x1e63;tr&#x00e2;va&#x015b;e&#x1e63;ita</em> mfn. id. MBh. xv, 988 (cf. <em>kath&#x00e2;va&#x015b;e&#x1e63;a</em> and <em>kath&#x0101;-&#x015b;e&#x1e63;a</em>.)</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kath&#x0101;mukha </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;mukha</em> n. the introduction to a tale Pa&#x00f1;cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the second Lambaka or book of the Kath&#x0101;-sarit-s&#x0101;gara</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kath&#x0101;m&#x1e5b;tanidhi </dt>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kath&#x0101;yoga </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;yoga</em> m. conversation, talk, discourse MBh. Hariv. Hit</dd>

           <dd><em>&#x25cb;"&#x1e63;rambha</em> (<em>kath&#x00e2;ra&#x25cb;</em>), m. beginning of a story or tale, story-telling </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-k&#x0101;la</em> m. story-beginning-time Hit. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p247-2"></a>[Page 247, Column 2]</font>
</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kath&#x0101;r&#x0101;ma </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;"&#x1e63;r&#x0101;ma</em> (<em>kath&#x00e2;r&#x0101;&#x25cb;</em>), m. garden of fable</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kath&#x0101;r&#x1e47;ava </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;"&#x1e63;r&#x1e47;ava</em> (<em>kath&#x00e2;r&#x1e47;a&#x25cb;</em>), m. N. of wk</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kath&#x0101;lak&#x1e63;a&#x1e47;a </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;lak&#x1e63;a&#x1e47;a</em> n. N. of wk</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kath&#x0101;l&#x0101;pa </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;"&#x1e63;l&#x0101;pa</em> (<em>kath&#x00e2;l&#x0101;&#x25cb;</em>), m. speech, conversation, discourse Kath&#x0101;s. Hit</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kath&#x0101;vat&#x0101;ra </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;"&#x1e63;vat&#x0101;ra</em> m. incarnation of Kath&#x0101; or Story</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kath&#x0101;val&#x012b; </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;"&#x1e63;val&#x012b;</em> (<em>kath&#x00e2;va&#x25cb;</em>), f. a string or collection of stories Kath&#x0101;s</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kath&#x0101;va&#x015b;e&#x1e63;a </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;"&#x1e63;va&#x015b;e&#x1e63;a</em> (<em>kath&#x00e2;va&#x25cb;</em>), m. a narrative as the only remainder, (<em>&#x25cb;&#x1e43;-&#x221a;gam</em>, to enter into a state in which nothing is left but the story of one's life, i.e. to die Naish.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (mfn.) one of whom nothing remains but his life-story, i.e. deceased, dead </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-t&#x0101;</em> f. the state of the above, (<em>kath&#x00e2;va&#x015b;e&#x1e63;at&#x0101;&#x1e43; gata&#x1e25;</em>, deceased, dead Prab.)</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kath&#x0101;va&#x015b;e&#x1e63;&#x012b;bh&#x016b; </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;"&#x1e63;va&#x015b;e&#x1e63;&#x012b;-&#x221a;bh&#x016b;</em> (<em>kath&#x00e2;va&#x25cb;</em>), to die K&#x0101;d. (cf. the last.)</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kath&#x0101;virakta </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;virakta</em> mfn. disliking conversation, reserved, taciturn</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kath&#x0101;&#x015b;e&#x1e63;a </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;&#x015b;e&#x1e63;a</em> mfn. = <em>kath&#x00e2;va&#x015b;e&#x1e63;a</em> above R&#x0101;jat</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kath&#x0101;sa&#x1e43;graha </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;sa&#x1e43;graha</em> m. a collection of tales or fables</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kath&#x0101;sarits&#x0101;gara </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;sarit-s&#x0101;gara</em> m. 'the ocean of rivers of stories', N. of wk. by Soma-deva</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kathodaya </dt>
           <dd><em>kath&#x00f4;daya</em> m. the beginning of or introduction to a tale BhP</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kathodgh&#x0101;ta </dt>
           <dd><em>kath&#x00f4;dgh&#x0101;ta</em> m. the beginning of a tale Ragh. iv, 20 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in dram.) the opening of a drama by the character that first enters overhearing and repeating the last words of the S&#x016b;tradh&#x0101;ra or manager (cf. <em>udgh&#x0101;tyaka</em>) S&#x0101;h. 290 Da&#x015b;ar</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kathopakathana </dt>
           <dd><em>kath&#x00f4;pakathana</em> n. conversation, talking together, conference, narration</dd>

           <dd><em>kath&#x00f4;p&#x00e2;khy&#x0101;na</em> n. narration, narrative, relation, telling a story</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kath&#x0101;naka </dt>
           <dd><em>kath&#x0101;naka</em> n. a little tale Vet. Hcat. &amp;c</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kath&#x0101;paya </dt>
           <dd><em>kath&#x0101;paya</em> Nom. P. <em>kath&#x0101;payati</em>, to tell, relate, recite</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kathika </dt>
           <dd><em>kathika</em> mfn. a narrator, relater, story-teller by profession W</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kathita </dt>
           <dd><em>kathita</em> mfn. told, related, reckoned Mn. vii, 157 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), n. conversation, discourse MBh. &#x015a;ak </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; narration, tale Ragh. xi, 10</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kathitapada </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;pada</em> n. repetition, tautology W</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kath&#x012b;k&#x1e5b; </dt>
           <dd><em>kath&#x012b;-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em> to reduce to a mere tale</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kath&#x012b;k&#x1e5b;ta </dt>
           <dd><em>kath&#x012b;k&#x1e5b;ta</em> mfn. reduced to a mere tale, i.e. deceased, dead (e.g. <em>kath&#x012b;-k&#x1e5b;ta&#x1e43; vapu&#x1e25;</em>, a body reduced to a mere tale, a dead body Kum. iv, 13)</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kathya </dt>
           <dd><em>kathya</em> mfn. to be spoken about or told, fit to be mentioned R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be related Da&#x015b;</dd>

           <dt>katham </dt>
           <dd><em>kath&#x00e1;m</em> ind. (fr. 2. <em>ka</em>), how? in what manner? whence? (e.g. <em>katham etat</em>, how is that? <em>katham id&#x0101;n&#x012b;m</em>, how now? what is now to be done? <em>katham m&#x0101;r&#x00e2;tmake tvayi vi&#x015b;v&#x0101;sa&#x1e25;</em>, how can there be reliance on thee of murderous mind? <em>katham uts&#x1e5b;jya tv&#x0101;&#x1e43; gaccheyam</em>, how can I go away deserting you? <em>katham buddhv&#x0101; bhavi&#x1e63;yati s&#x0101;</em>, how will she be when she awakes? <em>katham m&#x1e5b;tyu&#x1e25;</em>, <em>prabhavati vedavid&#x0101;m</em>, whence is it that death has power over those that know the Veda? <em>katham avagamyate</em>, whence is it inferred?) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sometimes <em>katham</em> merely introduces an interrogation (e.g. <em>katham &#x0101;tm&#x0101;na&#x1e43; niveday&#x0101;mi katha&#x1e43; v&#x00e2;tm&#x00e2;pah&#x0101;ra&#x1e43; karomi</em>, shall I declare myself or shall I withdraw?) <em>katham</em> is often found in connection with the particles <em>iva</em>, <em>n&#x0101;ma</em>, <em>nu</em>, <em>svid</em>, which appear to generalize the interrogation (how possibly? how indeed? &amp;c.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>nu</em> it is sometimes = <em>kimu</em>, or <em>kutas</em> (e.g. <em>katka&#x1e43; nu</em>, how much more! <em>na katha&#x1e43; nu</em>, how much less!) <em>katham</em> is often connected, like <em>kim</em>, with the particles <em>cana</em>, <em>cid</em>, and <em>api</em>, which give an indefinite sense to the interrogative (e.g. <em>katha&#x1e43; cana</em>, in any way, some how </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; scarcely, with difficulty </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>na katha&#x1e43; cana</em>, in no way at all </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>katha&#x1e43;cit</em>, some how or other, by some means or other, in any way, with some difficulty, scarcely, in a moderate degree, a little </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>na katha&#x1e43;cit</em>, not at all, in no way whatever </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>na katha&#x1e43;cid na</em>, in no way not, i.e. most decidedly </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>yath&#x0101; katha&#x1e43;cit</em>, in any way whatsoever </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>katha&#x1e43;cid yadi j&#x012b;vati</em>, it is with difficulty that he lives </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>katham api</em>, some how or other, with some difficulty, scarcely a little </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>katham api na</em>, by no means, not at all) RV. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; according to lexicographers <em>katham</em> is a particle implying amazement </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; surprise </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pleasure </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; abuse</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; katha&#x1e43; </dt>
           <dd><em>katha&#x1e43;</em> (in comp. for <em>katham</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; at the beginning of an adjective compound it may also have the sense of <em>kim</em>)</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; katha&#x1e43;ruru </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;ruru</em> m. N. of a R&#x0101;jarshi S&#x0101;y. on RV. iv, 16, 10</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; katha&#x1e43;r&#x016b;pa </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;r&#x016b;pa</em> mfn. of what shape? R</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; katha&#x1e43;v&#x012b;rya </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;v&#x012b;rya</em> mfn. of what power? R. iii, 73, 9</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; katha&#x1e43;kathika </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;kathika</em> mfn. one who is always asking questions, an inquisitive person L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-t&#x0101;</em> f. questioning, inquiring, inquisitiveness L</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; katha&#x1e43;karman </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;karman</em> mfn. how acting?</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; katha&#x1e43;k&#x0101;ram </dt>

           <dt>&#x22d9; katha&#x1e43;j&#x0101;t&#x012b;yaka </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;j&#x0101;t&#x012b;yaka</em> mfn. of what kind? Pat</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; katha&#x1e43;tar&#x0101;m </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;tar&#x0101;m</em> ind. still more how or why? (used in emphatic questions) Sarvad. 105, 12. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p247-3"></a>[Page 247, Column 3]</font>
</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; katha&#x1e43;t&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;t&#x0101;</em> f. 'the how', the what state? Yogas</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; katha&#x1e43;pram&#x0101;&#x1e47;a </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;pram&#x0101;&#x1e47;a</em> mfn. of what measure? R</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; katha&#x1e43;bh&#x0101;va </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;bh&#x0101;va</em> m. = <em>-t&#x0101;</em> above Comm. on K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; katha&#x1e43;bh&#x016b;ta </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;bh&#x016b;ta</em> mfn. how being, of what kind? Caurap</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kath&#x0101; 2</dt>
           <dd><em>kath&#x0101;&#x0341;</em> (for 1. col. 1), ind. (Ved. for <em>kath&#x00e1;m</em> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 5-3, 26) how? whence? why? RV. AV. viii, 1, 16 TS. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>yath&#x0101;&#x0341; kath&#x0101;&#x0341; ca</em>, in any way whatsoever &#x015a;Br. iv) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sometimes merely a particle of interrogation (e.g. <em>kath&#x0101;&#x0341; &#x015b;&#x1e5b;&#x1e47;oti</em>.. <em>&#x00ed;ndra&#x1e25;</em>, does Indra hear? RV. iv, 23, 3 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kath&#x0101;&#x0341;-kath&#x0101;&#x0341;</em>, whether-or? TS. ii, 6, 1, 7)</dd>

           <dt>kad 1</dt>
           <dd><em>kad</em> cl. 1. &#x0100;. <em>kadate</em>, <em>cak&#x0101;da</em> (R. ed. Gorresio vi, 65, 23 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; but ed. Bomb. vi, 86, 24 reads <em>cak&#x0101;ra</em>), to be confused, suffer mentally </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to grieve </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to confound </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to kill or hurt </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to call </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to cry or shed tears Dh&#x0101;tup. xix, 10</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kadana </dt>
           <dd><em>kadana</em> n. destruction, killing, slaughter MBh. R. Pa&#x00f1;cat. &amp;c</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kadanapura </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;pura</em> n. N. of a town L</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kadanapriya </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;priya</em> mfn. loving slaughter BhP. vii, 12, 13</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kadamba </dt>
           <dd><em>kadamba</em> m. (U&#x1e47;. iv, 82) Nauclea Cadamba (a tree with orange-coloured fragrant blossoms) MBh. Su&#x015b;r. Megh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; white mustard L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Andropogon Serratus L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; turmeric L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a particular mineral substance L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a particular position of the hand </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in astron.) the pole of the ecliptic Comm. on S&#x016b;ryas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an arrow (cf. <em>k&#x0101;damba</em>) L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a dynasty </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x012b;</em>), f. N. of a plant L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), n. a multitude, assemblage, collection, troop, herd G&#x012b;t. S&#x0101;h. &amp;c</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kadambada </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;da</em> m. Sinapis Dichotoma L</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kadambapu&#x1e63;p&#x0101; </dt>

           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x012b;</em>), f. N. of a plant Su&#x015b;r</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kadamb&#x0101;nila </dt>
           <dd><em>kadamb&#x00e2;nila</em> m. a fragrant breeze </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 'accompanied by fragrant breezes', the rainy season Kir. iv, 24</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kadambaka </dt>
           <dd><em>kadambaka</em> m. Nauclea Cadamba VarB&#x1e5b;S </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Sinapis Dichotoma L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Curcuma Aromatica </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>ik&#x0101;</em>), f. a particular muscle in the nape of the neck (cf. <em>kalambik&#x0101;</em>) L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), n. multitude, troop, herd &#x015a;ak. Kir. &#x015a;i&#x015b;</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kadambak&#x012b;k&#x1e5b; </dt>
           <dd><em>kadambak&#x012b;-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em> to transform into flowers of the Kadambaka MBh. vii, 6276</dd>

           <dt>kad 2</dt>
           <dd><em>k&#x00e1;d</em> ind. (originally the neuter form of the interrogative pronoun <em>ka</em>), a particle of interrogation (= Lat. <em>nonne</em>, <em>num</em>) RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; anything wrong or bad BhP. vii, 5, 28 (cf. below) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>sukha</em> Nigh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kad</em> is used, like <em>kim</em>, with the particles <em>cana</em> and <em>cid</em>, 'sometimes, now and then' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kac-cana</em> with the negation <em>na</em>, 'in no way or manner' RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kac-cid</em> is also used, like the simple <em>kad</em>, as a particle of interrogation (e.g. <em>kaccid d&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;&#x0101; tvay&#x0101; r&#x0101;jan damayant&#x012b;</em>, was Damayant&#x012b; seen by thee, O king?) MBh., or <em>kaccid</em> may be translated by 'I hope that' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; at the beginning of a compound it may mark the uselessness, badness or defectiveness of anything, as in the following examples</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kadak&#x1e63;ara </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;ak&#x1e63;ara</em> n. a bad letter, bad writing L</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kadagni </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;agni</em> m. a little fire Vop</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kadadhvan </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;adhvan</em> m. a bad road L</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kadanna </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;anna</em> n. bad food or little food, Bhp. &#x015a;&#x0101;r&#x1e45;g </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (mfn.) eating bad food VarB&#x1e5b;S </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-t&#x0101;</em> f. the state of bad food VC&#x0101;&#x1e47;</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kadapatya </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;apatya</em> n. bad posterity, bad children BhP</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kadartha </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;artha</em> m. a useless thing </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (mfn.) having what purpose or aim? RV. x, 22, 6 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; useless, unmeaning W</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kadarthana </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;"&#x1e63;arthana</em> <em>am</em>, <em>&#x0101;</em> n. f. (fr. <em>kadarthaya</em> below), the act of tormenting, torture, trouble Da&#x015b;. Kath&#x0101;s</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kadarthan&#x012b;ya </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;"&#x1e63;arthan&#x012b;ya</em> mfn. (fr. the next), to be tormented or troubled Naish. Hcar</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kadarthaya </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;"&#x1e63;arthaya</em> Nom. (fr. <em>kad-artha</em>) P. <em>kadarthayati</em>, to consider as a useless thing, estimate lightly, despise Bhart&#x1e5b;. Vcar </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to torment, torture, trouble Pa&#x00f1;cat. Kath&#x0101;s. Naish. &amp;c</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kadarthita </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;"&#x1e63;arthita</em> mfn. rendered useless </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; despised, disdained, rejected</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kadarth&#x012b;k&#x1e5b; </dt>

           <dt>&#x226b; kanya </dt>
           <dd><em>kanya</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;</em>)n. the smallest (opposed to <em>uttama</em> and <em>madhyama</em>) Hcat. i, 302, 8 ff </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;&#x0341;</em>), f. <em>kany&#x0101;&#x0341;</em> below ; [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Zd">Zd.</a> <em>kainin</em> ; Hib. <em>cain</em>, 'chaste, undefiled.']</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kanyakubja </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;kubja</em> n. (<em>&#x0101;</em> f. L.), N. of an ancient city of great note (in the north-western provinces of India, situated on the <em>k&#x0101;l&#x012b; nad&#x012b;</em>, a branch of the Ga&#x1e45;g&#x0101;, in the modern district of Farrukhabad </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the popular spelling of the name presents, perhaps, greater variations than that of any place in India [e.g. <em>Kanauj</em>, <em>Kunnoj</em>, <em>Kunnouj</em>, <em>Kinoge</em>, <em>Kinnoge</em>, <em>Kinnauj</em>, <em>Kanoj</em>, <em>Kannauj</em>, <em>Kunowj</em>, <em>Canowj</em> <em>Canoje</em>, <em>Canauj</em>, &amp;c.] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in antiquity this city ranks next to Ayodhy&#x0101; in Oude </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; it is known in classical geography as Canogyza </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; but the name applies also to its dependencies and the surrounding district </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the current etymology [<em>kany&#x0101;</em>, 'a girl', shortened to <em>kanya</em>, and <em>kubja</em>, 'round-shouldered or crooked'] refers to a legend in R. i, 32, 11 ff., relating to the hundred daughters of Ku&#x015b;an&#x0101;bha, the king of this city, who were all rendered crooked by V&#x0101;yu for non-compliance with his licentious desires </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the ruins of the ancient city are said to occupy a site larger than that of London) MBh. Kath&#x0101;s. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-de&#x015b;a</em> m. the country round Kanyakubja</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kanyakum&#x0101;r&#x012b; </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;kum&#x0101;r&#x012b;</em> f. N. of Durg&#x0101; T&#x0100;r</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kanyaka </dt>
           <dd><em>kanyaka</em> mfn. the smallest Hcat. i, 302, 16 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. a girl, maiden, virgin, daughter MBh. &#x015a;ak. Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the constellation Virgo in the zodiac VarB&#x1e5b;S </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of Durg&#x0101; BhP. x, 2, 12 </dd>

           <dt>kam 1</dt>
           <dd><em>k&#x00e1;m</em> ind. (Gk. ?) well (opposed to <em>a-kam</em>, [251, 3] ill') TS. &#x015a;Br. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a particle placed after the word to which it belongs with an affirmative sense, 'yes', 'well' (but this sense is generally so weak that Indian grammarians are perhaps right in enumerating <em>kam</em> among the expletives Nir </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; it is often found attached to a dat. case, giving to that case a stronger meaning, and is generally placed at the end of the P&#x0101;da, e.g. <em>&#x00e1;j&#x012b;jana &#x00f3;&#x1e63;adh&#x012b;r bh&#x00f3;jan&#x0101;ya k&#x00e1;m</em>, thou didst create the plants for actual food RV. v, 83, 10) RV. AV. TS. v </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kam</em> is also used as an enclitic with the particles <em>nu</em>, <em>su</em>, and <em>hi</em> (but is treated in the Pada-p&#x0101;&#x1e6d;ha as a separate word </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in this connection <em>kam</em> has no accent but once AV. vi, 110, 1) RV. AV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a particle of interrogation (like <em>kad</em> and <em>kim</em>) RV. x, 52, 3 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (sometimes, like <em>kim</em> and <em>kad</em>, at the beginning of compounds) marking the strange or unusual character of anything or expressing reproach L. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p252-1"></a>[Page 252, Column 1]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; head L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; food Nir </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; water Nir. Nigh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; happiness, bliss L</dd>

           <dt>kam 2</dt>
           <dd><em>kam</em> cl. 1. &#x0100;. (not used in the conjugational tenses) <em>cakame</em>, <em>kamit&#x0101;</em>, <em>kami&#x1e63;yate</em>, <em>acakamata</em> Dh&#x0101;tup. xii, 10 to wish, desire, long for RV. v, 36, 1 ; x, 117, 2 AV. xix, 52, 3 &#x015a;Br. Ragh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to love, be in love with, have sexual intercourse with &#x015a;Br. xi BhP.: Caus. &#x0100;. (ep. also P.) <em>k&#x0101;mayate</em>, <em>-ti</em>, <em>k&#x0101;may&#x0101;&#x1e43;-cakre</em>, <em>ac&#x012b;kamata</em>, &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to wish, desire, long for (with acc. or inf. or Pot. P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 3-3, 157 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; e.g. <em>k&#x0101;maye bhu&#x00f1;j&#x012b;ta bhav&#x0101;n</em>, I wish your worship may eat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>k&#x0101;maye d&#x0101;tum</em>, I wish to give K&#x0101;&#x015b;.) RV. AV. TS. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to love, be in love with, have sexual intercourse with RV. x, 124, 5 ; 125, 5 &#x015a;Br. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to cause any one to love &#x1e5a;itus. (in that sense, P. Vop.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with <em>bahu</em> or <em>aty-artham</em>) to rate or value highly R.: Desid. <em>cikami&#x1e63;ate</em> and <em>cik&#x0101;mayi&#x1e63;ate</em>: Intens. <em>ca&#x1e43;kamyate</em> ; [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Lat">Lat.</a> <em>comis</em> ; also <em>amo</em>, with the loss of the initial, for <em>camo</em> ; <em>c&#x00e2;-rus</em> for <em>cam-rus</em>: Hib. <em>caemh</em>', love, desire </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fine, handsome, pleasant' ; <em>caomhach</em>, 'a friend, companion' ; <em>caomhaim</em>, 'I save, spare, protect' ; Armen. <em>kamim</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kamaka </dt>
           <dd><em>kamaka</em> m. N. of a man </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;s</em>), m. pl. the descendants of this man, g. <em>upak&#x00e2;di</em> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 2-4, 69</dd>

(ep. also P.) <em>kampate</em> (<em>-ti</em>), <em>cakampe</em>, <em>kampi&#x1e63;yate</em>, <em>akampi&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;a</em>, <em>kampit&#x0101;</em> (Dh&#x0101;tup. x, 13), to tremble, shake MBh.            <dd>&#x2022; to pronounce in a tremulous manner (i.e. with a thrill or shake): Desid. <em>cikampi&#x1e63;ate</em>: Intens. <em>ca&#x1e43;kampyate</em>, <em>ca&#x1e43;kampti</em> ; [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Gk">Gk.</a>? Hib. <em>cabh&#x00f4;g</em>, 'hastening.'] [252, 3]</dd>

           <dd><em>kampa</em> m. trembling, tremor, trembling motion, shaking MBh. Su&#x015b;r. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; earthquake (cf. <em>bh&#x016b;mi-kampa</em>, <em>mah&#x012b;-k&#x25cb;</em>, &amp;c.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; tremulous or thrilling pronunciation (a modification of the Svarita accent which may take place if the Svarita syllable is followed by an Ud&#x0101;tta syllable) Nir. &amp;c </dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kara&#x1e47;a </dt>
           <dd><em>k&#x00e1;ra&#x1e47;a</em> (once <em>kara&#x1e47;&#x00e1;</em> RV. i, 119, 7) mf(<em>&#x012b;</em>)n doing, making, effecting, causing (esp. ifc </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>antakara&#x1e47;a</em>, <em>u&#x1e63;&#x1e47;a&#x1e43;-k&#x25cb;</em>, &amp;c.) R. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; clever, skilful RV. i, 119, 7 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. a helper, companion AV. vi, 46, 2 ; xv, 5, 1-6 ; xix, 57, 3 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a man of a mixed class (the son of an outcast Kshatriya Mn. x, 22 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or the son of a &#x015a;&#x016b;dra woman by a Vai&#x015b;ya Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. i, 92 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or the son of a Vai&#x015b;ya woman by a Kshatriya MBh. i, 2446 ; 4521 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the occupation of this class is writing, accounts &amp;c.) a writer, scribe W </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in Gr.) a sound or word as an independent part of speech (or as separated from the context </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in this sense usually n.) K&#x0101;&#x015b;. on P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 3-1, 41 Pat. Comm. on RPr&#x0101;t </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in mus.) a kind of time Kum. vi, 40 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x012b;</em>), f. a woman of the above mixed tribe Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. i, 95 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with <em>sut&#x0101;</em>) an adopted daughter R. (ed. Gorr.) i, 19, 9 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in arithm.) a surd or irrational number, surd &#x221a; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the side of a square, &#x015a;ulbas. Comm. on VS </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a particular measure Comm. on K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a particular position of the fingers </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), n. the act of making, doing, producing, effecting &#x015a;Br. MBh. &amp;c. (very often ifc., e.g. <em>mu&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;i-k&#x25cb;</em>, <em>vir&#x016b;pa-k&#x25cb;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an act, deed RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an action (esp. a religious one) Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. i, 250 R </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the special business of any tribe or caste L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a calculation (esp. an astronomical one) VarB&#x1e5b;S </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an astrological division of the day (these Kara&#x1e47;as are eleven, viz. <em>vava</em>, <em>valava</em>, <em>kaulava</em>, <em>taitila</em>, <em>gara</em>, <em>va&#x1e47;ija</em>, <em>vi&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;i</em>, <em>&#x015b;akuni</em>, <em>catu&#x1e63;pada</em>, <em>kintughna</em>, and <em>n&#x0101;ga</em>, two being equal to a lunar day </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the first seven are called <em>a-dhruv&#x0101;&#x1e47;i</em> or movable, and fill, eight times repeated, the space from the second half of the first day in the moon's increase to the first half of the fourteenth day in its wane </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the four others are <em>dhruv&#x0101;&#x1e47;i</em> or fixed, and occupy the four half-days from the second half of the fourteenth day in the wane of the moon to the first half of the first day in its increase) VarB&#x1e5b;S. Su&#x015b;r. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pronunciation, articulation, APr&#x0101;t </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in Gr.) a sound or word as an independent part of speech, separated from its context P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. K&#x0101;&#x015b;. &amp;c., (<em>kara&#x1e47;a</em> may be used in this way like <em>k&#x0101;ra</em> e.g. <em>iti-kara&#x1e47;a</em> &#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;kh&#x015a;r.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the posture of an ascetic </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a posture in sexual intercourse </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; instrument, means of action &#x015a;vetUp. Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. Megh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an organ of sense or of speech VPr&#x0101;t. P&#x0101;rG&#x1e5b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in law) an instrument, document, bond Mn. viii, 51 ; 52 ; 154 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in Gr.) the means or instrument by which an action is effected, the idea expressed by the instrumental case, instrumentality P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-4, 42 ; ii, 3, 18 ; iii, 2, 45 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cause (= <em>k&#x0101;ra&#x1e47;a</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a spell, charm Kath&#x0101;s. (cf. <em>kara&#x1e47;a-prayoga</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; rhythm, time Kum </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; body Megh. Kum. K&#x0101;d </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a treatise of Var&#x0101;ha-mihira on the motion of the planets </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a work belonging to the &#x015a;iva-dar&#x015b;ana </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a field L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the mind, heart W. (cf. <em>anta&#x1e25;-kara&#x1e47;a</em>) </dd>

           <dt>karman </dt>
           <dd><em>k&#x00e1;rman</em> <em>a</em> n. (<em>&#x0101;</em> m. L.), (&#x221a;<em>k&#x1e5b;</em> U&#x1e47;. iv, 144), act, action, performance, business RV. AV. &#x015a;Br. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; office, special duty, occupation, obligation (frequently ifc., the first member of the compound being either the person who performs the action [e.g. <em>va&#x1e47;ik-k&#x25cb;</em>] or the person or thing for or towards whom the action is performed [e.g. <em>r&#x0101;ja-k&#x25cb;</em>, <em>pa&#x015b;u-k&#x25cb;</em>] or a specification of the action [e.g. <em>&#x015b;aurya-k&#x25cb;</em>, <em>pr&#x012b;ti-k&#x25cb;</em>]) &#x015a;Br. Mn. Bhart&#x1e5b;. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; any religious act or rite (as sacrifice, oblation &amp;c., esp. as originating in the hope of future recompense and as opposed to speculative religion or knowledge of spirit) RV. AV. VS. Ragh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; work, labour, activity (as opposed to rest, <em>pra&#x015b;&#x0101;nti</em>) Hit. RPr&#x0101;t. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; physicking, medical attendance Car </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; action consisting in motion (as the third among the seven categories of the Ny&#x0101;ya philosophy </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of these motions there are five, viz. <em>ut-k&#x1e63;epa&#x1e47;a</em>, <em>ava-k&#x1e63;epa&#x1e47;a</em>, <em>&#x0101;-ku&#x00f1;cana</em>, <em>pras&#x0101;ra&#x1e47;a</em>, and <em>gamana</em>, qq. vv.) Bh&#x0101;sh&#x0101;p. Tarkas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; calculation S&#x016b;ryas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; product, result, effect Mn. xii, 98 Su&#x015b;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; organ of sense &#x015a;Br. xiv (or of action, <em>karm&#x00ea;ndriya</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in Gr.) the object (it stands either in the acc. <em>in active construction</em>, or in the nom. <em>in passive construction</em>, or in the gen. <em>in connection with a noun of action</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; opposed to <em>kart&#x1e5b;</em> the subject) P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-4, 49 ff. (it is of four kinds, viz. a. <em>nirvartya</em>, when anything new is produced, e.g. <em>ka&#x1e6d;a&#x1e43; karoti</em>, 'he makes a mat' <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p258-3"></a>[Page 258, Column 3]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>putra&#x1e43; pras&#x016b;te</em>, 'she bears a son' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; b. <em>vik&#x0101;rya</em>, when change is implied either of the substance and form, e.g. <em>k&#x0101;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;ha&#x1e43; bhasma karoti</em>, 'he reduces fuel to ashes' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or of the form only, e.g. <em>suvar&#x1e47;a&#x1e43; ku&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;ala&#x1e43; karoti</em>, 'he fashions gold into an ear-ring' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; c. <em>pr&#x0101;pya</em>, when any desired object is attained, e.g. <em>gr&#x0101;ma&#x1e43; gacchati</em>, 'he goes to the village' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>candra&#x1e43; pa&#x015b;yati</em>, 'he sees the moon' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; d. <em>an&#x012b;psita</em>, when an undesired object is abandoned, e.g. <em>p&#x0101;pa&#x1e43; tyajati</em>, 'he leaves the wicked') </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; former act as leading to inevitable results, fate (as the certain consequence of acts in a previous life) Pa&#x00f1;cat. Hit. Buddh., (cf. <em>karma-p&#x0101;ka</em> and <em>-vip&#x0101;ka</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the tenth lunar mansion VarB&#x1e5b;S. &amp;c</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; karma </dt>
           <dd><em>karma</em> (in comp. for <em>k&#x00e1;rman</em> above)</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; m. N. of Yama L </dd>

           <dt>kalahu </dt>
           <dd><em>kalahu</em> m. (f. ?) a particular high number Lalit. (cf. <em>karahu</em>.)</dd>

           <dt>kal&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>kal&#x0101;&#x0341;</em> f. (etym. doubtful) a small part of anything, any single part or portion of a whole, esp. a sixteenth part RV. viii, 47, 17 TS. &#x015a;Br. Mn. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a digit or one-sixteenth of the moon's diameter Hit. Kath&#x0101;s </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (personified as a daughter of Kardama and wife of Mar&#x012b;ci BhP.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a symbolical expression for the number sixteen Hcat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; interest on a capital (considered as a certain part of it) &#x015a;i&#x015b;. ix, 32 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a division of time (said to be 1/900 of a day or 1-6 minutes Mn. i, 64 Hariv </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or 1/1800 of a day or 0-8 minutes Comm. on VP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or 2 minutes and 26 54/201 seconds Su&#x015b;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or 1 minute and 35 205/301, seconds, or 8 seconds BhavP.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the sixtieth part of one-thirtieth of a zodiacal sign, a minute of a degree S&#x016b;ryas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in prosody) a syllabic instant </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a term for the seven substrata of the elements or Dh&#x0101;tus of the human body (viz. flesh, blood, fat, phlegm, urine, bile, and semen </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; but according to Hemacandra, <em>rasa</em>, 'chyle', <em>asthi</em>, 'bone', and <em>majjan</em>, 'marrow', take the place of phlegm, urine, and bile) Su&#x015b;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an atom (there are 3015 Kal&#x0101;s or atoms in every one of the six Dh&#x0101;tus, not counting the <em>rasa</em>, therefore in all 18090) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with P&#x0101;&#x015b;upatas) the elements of the gross or material world Sarvad </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an embryo shortly after conception (cf. <em>kalana</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a designation of the three constituent parts of a sacrifice (viz. <em>mantra</em>, <em>dravya</em>, and <em>&#x015b;raddh&#x0101;</em> N&#x012b;lak. on MBh. <em>ed. Bomb.</em> xiv, 89, 3) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the menstrual discharge L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; any practical art, any mechanical or fine art (sixty-four are enumerated in the &#x015a;aivatantra <em>&#x1e6d;.</em> </dd>

           <dt>kali </dt>
           <dd><em>k&#x00e1;li</em> m. (&#x221a;1. <em>kal</em> Comm. on U&#x1e47;. iv, 117), N. of the die or side of a die marked with one dot, the losing die AV. vii, 109, 1 &#x015a;Br. &amp;c. (personified as an evil genius in the episode of Nala) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; symbolical expression for the number 1 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Terminalia Bellerica (the nuts of which in older times were used as dice) L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the last and worst of the four Yugas or ages, the present age, age of vice AitBr. Mn. i, 86 ; ix, 301 f. MBh. &amp;c. (the Kali age contains, inclusive of the two dawns, 1200 years of the gods or 432, 000 years of men, and begins the eighteenth of February, 3102 B. C </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; at the end of this Yuga the world is to be destroyed </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>yuga</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; strife, discord, quarrel, contention (personified as the son of <em>krodha</em>, 'Anger', and <em>hi&#x1e43;s&#x0101;</em>, 'Injury', and as generating with his sister <em>durukti</em>, 'Calumny.' two children, viz. <em>bhaya</em>, 'Fear', and <em>m&#x1e5b;tyu</em>, 'Death' BhP. iv, 8, 3 ; 4) MBh. Hit. &amp;c. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p262-1"></a>[Page 262, Column 1]</font> </dd>

           <dd><em>kalkin</em> mfn. foul, turbid, having sediment, dirty W </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; wicked W </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x012b;</em>), m. = <em>kalki</em> above</dd>

           <dt>kalkala </dt>
           <dd><em>kalkala</em> <em>&#x0101;s</em> m. pl., N. of a people VP</dd>

           <dt>kalku&#x1e63;&#x012b; </dt>
           <dd><em>kalku&#x1e63;&#x012b;&#x0341;</em> f. or n. du. wrist and elbow &#x015a;Br. x, 2, 6, 14</dd>

           <dt>kalpa 1</dt>
           <dd><em>k&#x00e1;lpa</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;</em>)n. (&#x221a;<em>k&#x1e37;p</em>), practicable, feasible, possible &#x015a;Br. ii, 4, 3, 3 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; proper, fit, able, competent, equal to (with gen., loc., inf., or ifc </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; e.g. <em>dharmasya kalpa&#x1e25;</em>, competent for duty </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>svakarma&#x1e47;i na kalpa&#x1e25;</em>, not competent for his own work </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>yad&#x0101; na &#x015b;&#x0101;situ&#x1e43; kalpa&#x1e25;</em>, if he is not able to rule) BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. a sacred precept, law, rule, ordinance (= <em>vidhi</em>, <em>ny&#x0101;ya</em>), manner of acting, proceeding, practice (esp. that prescribed by the Vedas) RV. ix, 9, 7 AV. viii, 9, 10 ; xx, 128, 6-11 MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>prathama&#x1e25; kalpa&#x1e25;</em>, a rule to be observed before any other rule, first duty Mn. iii, 147 MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>etena kalpena</em>, in this way </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>pa&#x015b;u-k&#x25cb;</em>, &amp;c.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the most complete of the six Ved&#x0101;&#x1e45;gas (that which prescribes the ritual and gives rules for ceremonial or sacrificial acts) Mu&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;Up. P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; one of two cases, one side of an argument, an alternative (= <em>pak&#x1e63;a</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>vikalpa</em>) Sarvad </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; investigation, research Comm. on S&#x0101;&#x1e43;khyak </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; resolve, determination MW </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in medic.) treatment of the sick, manner of curing Su&#x015b;r. ii </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the art of preparing medicine, pharmacy Car </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the doctrine of poisons and antidotes Su&#x015b;r. i </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (ifc.) having the manner or form of anything, similar to, resembling, like but with a degree of inferiority, almost (e.g. <em>abhedya-kalpa</em>, almost impenetrable </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>prabh&#x0101;ta-k&#x25cb;</em>, <em>m&#x1e5b;ta-k&#x25cb;</em>, &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; according to native grammarians, <em>kalpa</em> so used is an accentless affix [P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 5-3, 67], before which a final <em>s</em> is left unchanged, and final <em>&#x012b;</em> and <em>&#x016b;</em> shortened P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. Vop </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kalpam</em> ind., may be also connected with a verb, e.g. <em>pacati-kalpam</em>, he cooks pretty well K&#x0101;&#x015b;. on P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 8-1, 57) <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p262-3"></a>[Page 262, Column 3]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a fabulous period of time (a day of Brahm&#x0101; or one thousand Yugas, a period of four thousand, three hundred and twenty millions of years of mortals, measuring the duration of the world </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a month of Brahm&#x0101; is supposed to contain thirty such Kalpas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; according to the MBh., twelve months of Brahm&#x0101; constitute his year, and one hundred such years his lifetime </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fifty years of Brahm&#x0101;'s are supposed to have elapsed, and we are now in the <em>&#x015b;vetav&#x0101;r&#x0101;ha-kalpa</em> of the fifty-first </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; at the end of a Kalpa the world is annihilated </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; hence <em>kalpa</em> is said to be equal to <em>kalp&#x00e2;nta</em> below L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with Buddhists the Kalpas are not of equal duration) VP. BhP. R&#x0101;jat. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of Mantras which contain a form of &#x221a;<em>k&#x1e37;p</em> TS. v &#x015a;Br. ix </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a kind of dance </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the first astrological mansion VarB&#x1e5b;S </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a son of Dhruva and Bhrami BhP. iv, 10, 1 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of &#x015a;iva MBh. xii, 10368 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the tree of paradise </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>-taru</em> below L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with Jainas) a particular abode of deities (cf. <em>-bhava</em> and <em>kalp&#x00e2;t&#x012b;ta</em> below) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), n. a kind of intoxicating liquor (incorrect for <em>kalya</em>) L</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>kava&#x1e6d;&#x012b;</em>.)</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kav&#x0101;&#x1e6d;aghna </dt>

           <dt>kavi </dt>
           <dd><em>kav&#x00ed;</em> mfn. (&#x221a;1. <em>k&#x016b;</em>, <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#2">2.</a> <em>kava</em>, <em>&#x0101;&#x0341;k&#x016b;ta</em>, <em>&#x0101;&#x0341;k&#x016b;ti</em>, <em>k&#x0101;vya</em> Naigh. iii, 15 Nir. xii, 13 U&#x1e47;. iv, 138) gifted with insight, intelligent, knowing, enlightened, wise, sensible, prudent, skilful, cunning </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>is</em>), m. a thinker, intelligent man, man of understanding, leader </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a wise man, sage, seer, prophet </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a singer, bard, poet (but in this sense without any technical application in the Veda) RV. VS. TS. AV. &#x015a;Br. i, 4, 2, 8 Ka&#x1e6d;hUp. iii, 14 MBh. Bhag. Bh&#x0101;gP. Mn. vii, 49 R. Ragh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of several gods, (esp.) of Agni RV. ii, 23, 1 ; x, 5, 4, 3 ; iii, 5, 1 ; i, 31, 2 ; 76, 5 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of Varu&#x1e47;a, Indra, the A&#x015b;vins, Maruts, &#x0100;dityas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of the Soma </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of the Soma priest and other sacrificers </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (probably) N. of a particular poet </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>&#x00e1;&#x1e45;giras</em> (Mn. ii, 151) and <em>u&#x015b;&#x00e1;nas</em> (Bhag. x, 37) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of the ancient sages or patriarchs (as spirits now surrounding the sun) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of the &#x1e5a;ibhus (as skilful in contrivance) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of P&#x016b;shan (as leader or guider) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a son of Brahm&#x0101; MBh. xiii, 4123, 4142-4150 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of Brahm&#x0101; W </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Bh&#x1e5b;igu and father of &#x015a;ukra MBh. i, 2606 (cf. 3204 Bh&#x0101;gP. iv, 1, 45 and Kull. on Mn. iii, 198) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; that of &#x015a;ukra (regent of the planet Venus and preceptor of the demons) R&#x0101;jat. iv, 495 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of the planet Venus NBD </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of the sons of several Manus Hariv. Bh&#x0101;gP. VP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of Kau&#x015b;ika and pupil of Garga Hariv </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of &#x1e5a;ishabha Bh&#x0101;gP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of V&#x0101;lm&#x012b;ki L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a keeper or herd RV. vii, 18, 8 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (fig.) N. of the gates of the sacrificial enclosure TS. v, 11, 1, 2 (cf. <em>kav&#x00e1;&#x1e63;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the sun W </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of various men </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the soul in the S&#x0101;&#x1e43;khya philosophy Comm </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a cunning fighter L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an owl L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>is</em>, or <em>&#x012b;</em> W.), f. the bit of a bridle L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the reins (cf. <em>kavik&#x0101;</em>) W </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; by his other twelve wives he was father of demons, n&#x0101;gas, reptiles, birds, and all kinds of living things </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; he is one of the seven great &#x1e5a;ishis and priest of Para&#x015b;u-r&#x0101;ma and R&#x0101;ma-candra </dd>

           <dd><em>k&#x0101;&#x0341;mam</em> ind. (acc. of <em>k&#x0101;&#x0341;ma</em> g. <em>svar&#x00e2;di</em>, not in K&#x0101;&#x015b;.) according to wish or desire, according to inclination, agreeably to desire, at will, freely, willingly RV. TS. AitBr. &#x015a;Br. ChUp. MBh. R. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with pleasure, readily, gladly MBh. iii, 298 Ragh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (as a particle of assent) well, very well, granted, admitted that, indeed, really, surely MBh. iii, 17195 R. v, 24, 4 &#x015a;ak. Bhart&#x1e5b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; well and good, in any case, at any rate MBh. iii, 310, 19 R. iv, 9, 105 ; v, 53, 11 &#x015a;ak. Dh&#x016b;rtas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with <em>na</em>, 'in no case' R. iii, 56, 17) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; granted that, in spite of that, notwithstanding R. iv, 16, 50 Pa&#x00f1;cat. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; though, although, supposing that (usually with Impv.) R. vi, 95, 49 and 56 Ragh. ii, 43 &#x015a;&#x0101;nti&#x015b;. (<em>k&#x0101;ma&#x1e43;-na</em> or <em>na tu</em> or <em>na ca</em>, rather than, e.g. <em>k&#x0101;mam &#x0101; mara&#x1e47;&#x0101;t ti&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;hed g&#x1e5b;he kany&#x0101;</em> - <em>na en&#x0101;m prayacchet tu gu&#x1e47;a-h&#x012b;n&#x0101;ya</em>, 'rather should a girl stay at home till her death, than that he should give her to one void of excellent qualities' Mn. ix, 89 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the negative sentence with <em>na</em> or <em>natu</em> or <em>na ca</em> may also precede, or its place may be taken by an interrogative sentence, e.g. <em>k&#x0101;ma&#x1e43; nayatu m&#x0101;&#x1e43; deva&#x1e25; kim ardhen&#x00e2;tmano hi me</em>, 'rather let the god take me, what is the use to me of half my existence?' BhP. vii, 2, 54 <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p273-2"></a>[Page 273, Column 2]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>k&#x0101;ma&#x1e43;</em> - <em>tu</em> or <em>ki&#x1e43; tu</em> or <em>ca</em> or <em>punar</em> or <em>ath&#x00e2;pi</em> or <em>tath&#x00e2;pi</em>, well, indeed, surely, truly, granted, though - however, notwithstanding, nevertheless, e.g. <em>k&#x0101;ma&#x1e43; tvay&#x0101; parityakt&#x0101; gami&#x1e63;y&#x0101;mi</em> - <em>ima&#x1e43; tu b&#x0101;la&#x1e43; sa&#x1e43;tyaktu&#x1e43;</em>, <em>n&#x00e2;rhasi</em>, 'granted that forsaken by thee I shall go - this child however thou must not forsake' MBh. i, 3059 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or the disjunctive particles may be left out R. Ragh. ii, 43 &#x015a;&#x0101;nti&#x015b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>yady-api-k&#x0101;ma&#x1e43; tath&#x00e2;pi</em>, though - nevertheless Prab.)</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; accord. to one legend he was son of &#x015a;iva without the intervention of P&#x0101;rvat&#x012b;, the generative energy of &#x015a;iva being cast into the fire and then received by the Ganges, whence he is sometimes described as son of Agni and Ga&#x1e45;g&#x0101; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; when born he was fostered by the six K&#x1e5b;ittik&#x0101;s, q.v., and these offering their six breasts to the child he became six-headed </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he is also called Kum&#x0101;ra, Skanda, and Subrahma&#x1e47;ya </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; his N. K&#x0101;rttikeya may be derived from his foster mothers or from the month K&#x0101;rttika as the best for warfare: in the M&#x1e5b;icch. and elsewhere he is regarded as presiding over thieves) MBh. &amp;c</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>kar&#x1e63;</em>) 'weighing a Karsha', a coin or weight of different values (if of gold, = 16 M&#x0101;shas, <em>kar&#x1e63;a</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; if of silver, = 16 Pa&#x1e47;as or 1280 Kowries, commonly termed a Kah&#x0101;n </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; if of copper, = 80 Raktik&#x0101;s or about 176 grains </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; but accord. to some = only 1 Pa&#x1e47;a of Kowries or 80 Kowries) Mn. viii, 136 ; 336 ; ix, 282 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (ifc.) worth so many K&#x0101;rsh&#x0101;pa&#x1e47;as P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 5-1, 29 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), n. money, gold and silver L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;s</em>), m. pl., N. of a warrior-tribe, g. <em>par&#x015b;v-&#x0101;di</em> </dd>

           <dt>k&#x0101;la 2</dt>
           <dd><em>k&#x0101;l&#x00e1;</em> m. (&#x221a;3. <em>kal</em>, 'to calculate or enumerate'), [ifc. f. <em>&#x0101;</em> RPr&#x0101;t.], a fixed or right point of time, a space of time, time (in general) AV. xix, 53 &amp; 54 &#x015a;Br. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the proper time or season for (gen., dat., loc., in comp., inf., or Pot. with <em>yad</em> e.g. <em>k&#x0101;la&#x1e25; prasth&#x0101;nasya</em> or <em>&#x25cb;n&#x0101;ya</em> or <em>&#x25cb;ne</em>, time for departure </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kriy&#x0101;-k&#x0101;la</em>, time for action Su&#x015b;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>n&#x00e2;ya&#x1e43; k&#x0101;lo vilambitum</em>, this is not the time to delay Nal </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>k&#x0101;lo yad bhu&#x00f1;j&#x012b;ta bhav&#x0101;n</em>, it is time for you to eat P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 3-3, 168 K&#x0101;&#x015b;.) &#x015a;Br. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; occasion, circumstance MBh. xii, 2950 M&#x1e5b;icch </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; season R. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; meal-time (twice a day, hence <em>ubhau k&#x0101;lau</em>, 'in the morning and in the evening' MBh. i, 4623 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x1e63;a&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;he k&#x0101;le</em>, 'in the evening of the third day' MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x1e63;a&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;h&#x00e2;nna-k&#x0101;la</em>, 'one who eats only at the sixth meal-time, i.e. who passes five meals without eating and has no meal till the evening of the third day' Mn. xi, 200 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or without <em>anna</em> e.g. <em>caturtha-k&#x0101;lam</em>, 'at the fourth meal-time, i.e. at the evening of the second day' Mn. xi, 109) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; hour (hence <em>&#x1e63;a&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;he k&#x0101;le'hna&#x1e25;</em>, 'at the sixth hour of the day, i.e. at noon' Vikr.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a period of time, time of the world (= <em>yuga</em>) R&#x0101;jat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; measure of time, prosody Pr&#x0101;t. P&#x0101;&#x1e47; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a section, part VPr&#x0101;t </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the end ChUp </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; death by age Su&#x015b;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; time (as leading to events, the causes of which are imperceptible to the mind of man), destiny, fate MBh. R. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; time (as destroying all things), death, time of death (often personified and represented with the attributes of Yama, regent of the dead, or even identified with him: hence <em>k&#x0101;lam-&#x221a;i</em> or <em>k&#x0101;la&#x1e43;-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em>, 'to die' MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>k&#x0101;la</em> in this sense is frequently connected with <em>antaka</em>, <em>m&#x1e5b;tyu</em> e.g. <em>abhy-adh&#x0101;vata praj&#x0101;&#x1e25; k&#x0101;la iv&#x00e2;ntaka&#x1e25;</em>, 'he attacked the people like Time the destroyer' R. iii, 7, 9 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>k&#x0101;l&#x00e2;ntaka</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>k&#x0101;la</em> personified is also a Devarshi in Indra's court, and a son of Dhruva MBh. i, 2585 Hariv. VP.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), acc. ind. for a certain time (e.g. <em>mah&#x0101;nta&#x1e43; k&#x0101;lam</em>, for a long time Pa&#x00f1;cat.) <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p278-2"></a>[Page 278, Column 2]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>nitya-k&#x25cb;</em>, constantly, always Mn. ii, 58 and 73 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>d&#x012b;rgha-k&#x25cb;</em>, during a long time Mn. viii, 145 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>ena</em>), instr. ind. in the course of time Mn. ix, 246 MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>gacchat&#x0101;</em> id. VP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>d&#x012b;rghe&#x1e47;a k&#x0101;lena</em>, during a long time MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; after a long time R. i, 45, 40 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>k&#x0101;lena mahat&#x0101;</em> or <em>bahun&#x0101;</em> id </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;t</em>), abl. ind. in the course of time Mn. viii, 251 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>k&#x0101;lasya d&#x012b;rghasya</em> or <em>mahata&#x1e25;</em> id. Mn. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kasya-cit k&#x0101;lasya</em>, after some time MBh. i, 5299 Hariv </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x00e9;</em>), loc. ind. in time, seasonably RV. x, 42, 9 &#x015a;Br. (cf. <em>a-k&#x0101;le</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>k&#x0101;le gacchati</em>, in the course of time </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>k&#x0101;le y&#x0101;te</em>, after some time </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>k&#x0101;le k&#x0101;le</em>, always in time MBh. i, 1680 Ragh. iv, 6 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; [cf. ? ; Lat. <em>calen-doe</em>: Hib. <em>ceal</em>, 'death and everything terrible.']</dd>
