           <dt>kim </dt>
           <dd><em>k&#x00ed;m</em> ind. (fr. 1. <em>ki</em>, originally nom. and acc. sg. n. of 2. <em>k&#x00e1;</em>, q.v.), what? how? whence? wherefore? why? <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p282-3"></a>[Page 282, Column 3]</font>
</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kim </dt>
           <dd><em>kim</em> is much used as a particle of interrogation like the Lat. <em>num</em>, <em>an</em>, sometimes translatable by 'whether?' but oftener serving only like a note of interrogation to mark a question (e.g. <em>ki&#x1e43; vy&#x0101;dh&#x0101; vane'smin sa&#x1e43;caranti</em>, 'do hunters roam about in this wood?' In an interrogation the verb, if uncompounded with a preposition, generally retains its accent after <em>kim</em> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 8-1, 44). To this sense may be referred the <em>kim</em> expressing inferiority, deficiency, &amp;c. at the beginning of compounds (e.g. <em>ki&#x1e43;-r&#x0101;jan</em>, what sort of king? i.e. a bad king P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 2-1, 64 ; v, 4, 70) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also the <em>kim</em> prefixed to verbs with a similar meaning (e.g. <em>kim-adh&#x012b;7te</em>, he reads badly P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 8-1, 44 K&#x0101;&#x015b;.) <em>kim-uta</em>, or <em>kim-uta-v&#x0101;</em> or <em>kim-athav&#x0101;-uta</em>, whether-or-or R. &#x015a;ak. Bhart&#x1e5b;. &amp;c. (cf. <em>ut&#x00e1;</em>.)</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kim </dt>
           <dd><em>kim</em> is very frequently connected with other particles, as follows: <em>k&#x00ed;m a&#x1e45;g&#x00e1;</em>, wherefore then? RV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>atha kim</em>, <em>&#x00e1;tha</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kim api</em>, somewhat, to a considerable extent, rather, much more, still further &#x015a;ak. Megh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kim iti</em>, why? &#x015a;ak. Kum. Pa&#x00f1;cat. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kim-iva</em>, what for? &#x015a;i&#x015b;. xvi, 31 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>k&#x00ed;m-u</em> or <em>k&#x00ed;m-ut&#x00e1;</em> how much more? how much less? RV. &#x015a;Br. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ki&#x1e43; kila</em>, what a pity! (expressing dissatisfaction) P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 3-3, 146 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ki&#x1e43;-ca</em>, moreover, further Pa&#x00f1;cat. Kath&#x0101;s. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; what more (expressing impatience) &#x015a;ak </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ki&#x1e43;-cana</em> (originally <em>-ca na</em>, negative = 'in no way'), to a certain degree, a little Kath&#x0101;s </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with a negation) in no way, not at all MBh. i, 6132 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ki&#x1e43;-cid</em>, somewhat, a little MBh. R. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ki&#x1e43; tarhi</em>, how then? but, however P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 2-2, 4 Pat. ; iv, 1, 163, Ka&#x015b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ki&#x1e43;-tu</em>, but, however, nevertheless (bearing the same relation to <em>tu</em> that <em>ki&#x1e43;-ca</em> bears to <em>ca</em>) MBh. R. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ki&#x1e43;-nu</em>, whether indeed? (a stronger interrogative than <em>kim</em> alone) MBh. R. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; how much more? how much less? Bhag. i, 35 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ki&#x1e43; nu khalu</em>, how possibly? (a still stronger interrogative) &#x015a;ak </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kim punar</em>, how much more? how much less? R. Bhag. ix, 33 &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; however B&#x0101;lar </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; but ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ki&#x1e43; v&#x0101;</em>, whether? or whether? &#x015a;ak. Pa&#x00f1;cat. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or (often a mere particle of interrogation) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>k&#x00ed;&#x1e43; svid</em>, why? Kath&#x0101;s. xxvi, 75 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a stronger interrogative than <em>kim</em> alone RV. MBh. Kath&#x0101;s</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; ki&#x1e43; 1</dt>
           <dd><em>ki&#x1e43;</em> (in comp. for <em>k&#x00ed;m</em>)</dd>

           <dd><em>&#x25cb;y&#x00fa;</em> mfn. what wishing? RV. iii, 33, 4</dd>

           <dd><em>&#x25cb;vid</em> mfn. what knowing? &#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;khBr</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ki&#x1e43;vidya </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;vidya</em> mfn. possessing the science of what? MBh. xii</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ki&#x1e43;vidha </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;vidha</em> mfn. of what kind? B&#x0101;lar</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ki&#x1e43;vibh&#x0101;ga </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;vibh&#x0101;ga</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;</em>)n. having what subdivisions? S&#x016b;ryas</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ki&#x1e43;vi&#x015b;e&#x1e63;a&#x1e47;a </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;vi&#x015b;e&#x1e63;a&#x1e47;a</em> mfn. distinguished by what? Comm. on Ny&#x0101;yad</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ki&#x1e43;vi&#x1e63;ayaka </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;vi&#x1e63;ayaka</em> mfn. relating to what? Comm. on B&#x0101;dar</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ki&#x1e43;v&#x012b;rya </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;v&#x012b;rya</em> mfn. of what power? R. BhP</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; ki&#x1e43;v&#x1e5b;tta </dt>

           <dd>&#x2022; originally perhaps a kind of monkey, cf. <em>v&#x0101;-nara</em> </dd>

           <dd><em>&#x25cb;puru&#x1e63;&#x00e1;</em> <em>"&#x1e63;Br. vii</em> or m. 'what sort of a man?' a mongrel being (according to the Br&#x0101;hma&#x1e47;as an evil being similar to man</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kimpuru&#x1e63;a </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;p&#x00fa;ru&#x1e63;a</em> <em>"&#x1e63;Br. i</em>, m. 'what sort of a man?' a mongrel being (according to the Br&#x0101;hma&#x1e47;as an evil being similar to man </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; perhaps originally a kind of monkey [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> xi, 16, 29] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in later times the word is usually identified with <em>ki&#x1e43;-nara</em>, though sometimes applied to other beings in which the figure of a man and that of an animal are combined </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; these beings are supposed to live on Hema-k&#x016b;&#x1e6d;a and are regarded as the attendants of Kubera </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with Jains the Kimpurushas, like the Ki&#x1e43;naras, belong to the Vyantaras) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of one of the nine sons of &#x0100;gn&#x012b;dhra (having the Varsha Kimpurusha as his hereditary portion) VP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a division of the earth (one of the nine Kha&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;as or portions into which the earth is divided, and described as the country between the Him&#x00e2;cala and Hema-k&#x016b;&#x1e6d;a mountains, also called <em>kimpuru&#x1e63;a-var&#x1e63;a</em> K&#x0101;d.) VP. BhP. MatsyaP. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x012b;</em>), f. a female Kimpurusha R. vii, 88, 22 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kimpuru&#x1e63;&#x012b;-</em> &#x221a;1. <em>k&#x1e5b;</em>, to change into a Kimpurusha ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kimpuru&#x1e63;&#x00ea;&#x015b;a</em> m. 'lord of the Kimpurushas', N. of Druma MBh. ii, 410 Hariv. 5014 = 5495 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x25cb;&#x1e63;&#x00ea;&#x015b;vara</em> m. N. of Kubera L</dd>

           <dt>kiyat </dt>
           <dd><em>k&#x00ed;yat</em> mfn. (fr. 1. <em>ki</em> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 5-2, 40 ; vi, 3, 90), how great? how large? how far? how much? of what extent? of what qualities? RV. AV. &amp;c.            <dd>&#x2022; little, small, unimportant, of small value (often in comp., e.g. <em>kiyad-vakra</em>, a little bent Comm. on Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kiyad api</em>, how large or how far soever Pa&#x00f1;cat </dd>

           <dt>kila 2</dt>
           <dd><em>k&#x00ed;la</em> ind. (a particle of asseveration or emphasis) indeed, verily, assuredly RV. AV. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (or of explanation) namely &#x015a;Br. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 'so said' 'so reported', pretendedly VarB&#x1e5b;S. K&#x0101;d </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>kila</em> is preceded by the word on which it lays stress, and occurs very rarely at the beginning of a sentence or verse [R. iv, 14, 14 Pa&#x00f1;cat. lxxxix, 4] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; according to native lexicographers <em>kila</em> may be used in communicating intelligence, and may imply 'probably', 'possibly', 'agreement', 'dislike', 'falsehood', 'inaccuracy', and 'reason.')</dd>

           <dt>ku 1</dt>
           <dd><em>ku</em> a pronom. base appearing in <em>k&#x00fa;tas</em>, <em>k&#x00fa;tra</em>, <em>kuv&#x00ed;d</em>, <em>k&#x00fa;ha</em>, <em>kv&#x00e1;</em>, and as a prefix implying deterioration, depreciation, deficiency, want, littleness, hindrance, reproach, contempt, guilt </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; originally perhaps <em>ku</em> signified 'how (strange!)' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; as a separate word <em>ku</em> occurs only in the lengthened form 3. <em>k&#x016b;&#x0341;</em>, q.v</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kukath&#x0101; </dt>

           <dt>kutas </dt>
           <dd><em>k&#x00fa;tas</em> ind. (fr. 1. <em>ku</em>), from whom? (for the abl. case of 2. <em>k&#x00e1;</em>) RV. i, 164, 18 AV. viii, 9, 4 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>kuta&#x1e25; k&#x0101;l&#x0101;t</em>, since what time? VP.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; from where? whence? RV. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; whereto? in which direction? BhP. viii, 19, 34 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101; kutas</em>, up to where? Pat.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; where? R. vii, 23, 3 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; wherefore? why? from what cause or motive? because L&#x0101;&#x1e6d;y. &amp;c. (often in dramas before verses giving the reason of what precedes) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; how? in what manner? ChUp. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; how much less? much less ChUp. Mu&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;Up. MBh. &amp;c. In <em>a-kutas</em>, which occurs in comp., <em>kutas</em> has an indefinite sense (e.g. <em>a-kuto-m&#x1e5b;tyu</em>, not fearing death from any quarter BhP. iii, 17, 19 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>a-kutobhaya</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kutas</em> is also indefinite when connected with the particles <em>api</em>, <em>cid</em>, <em>cana</em> (e.g. <em>kuto'pi</em>, from any quarter, from any cause Pa&#x00f1;cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kuto'pi k&#x0101;ra&#x1e47;&#x0101;t</em>, from any cause Prab </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kuta&#x015b;-cid</em>, from any one, from anywhere RV. Ka&#x1e6d;hUp. &amp;c. (cf. <em>akuta&#x015b;cid-bhaya</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kuta&#x015b; cana</em>, (with a negation preceding) from no side RV. TUp. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to no side R. v, 74, 21 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>yata&#x1e25; kuta&#x015b;-cid</em> from any person soever Comm. on K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r.)</dd>

           <dd><em>kuttha</em> (in astron.) the fifteenth Yoga VarB&#x1e5b;</dd>

           <dt>kutra </dt>
           <dd><em>k&#x00fa;tra</em> ind. (fr. 1. <em>ku</em>), where? whereto? in which case? when? RV. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; wherefore? Pa&#x00f1;cat. Hit </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kutra-kva</em>, where (this) -where (that), i.e. how distant or how different is this from that, how little is this consistent with that? BhP. vii, 9, 25. <em>kutra</em> becomes indefinite when connected with the particles <em>api</em>, <em>cid</em> e.g. <em>kutr&#x00e2;pi</em>, anywhere, somewhere, wherever, to any place, wheresoever Pa&#x00f1;cat. M&#x0101;rkP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>k&#x00fa;tr&#x0101; cid</em> <em>&#x1e5b;V.</em> or <em>kutra cid</em> [R. &amp;c.], anywhere, somewhere, wheresoever </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>na kutra cid</em>, nowhere, to no place whatsoever MBh. Pa&#x00f1;cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>kasmi&#x1e43;&#x015b;-cid</em> e.g. <em>kutra cid ara&#x1e47;ye</em>, in a certain wood Pa&#x00f1;cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kutra cid-kutra cid</em>, in one case-in the other case, sometimes-sometimes Mn. ix, 34 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>yatra kutra cid</em>, wherever it be, here or there Comm. on KapS. i, 69</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kutratya </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;tya</em> mfn. where living or residing? BhP. Da&#x015b;. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p290-3"></a>[Page 290, Column 3]</font>
</dd>

           <dt>kuts </dt>
           <dd><em>kuts</em> (perhaps related to <em>k&#x00fa;tas</em>), cl. 10. P. <em>kutsayati</em> [also &#x0100;. <em>&#x25cb;yate</em> Dh&#x0101;tup </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; rarely cl. 1. P. <em>kutsati</em> MBh. ii, 2298 and 2303 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; once cl. 4. P. <em>kutsyati</em> R. vii, 43, 18], to despise, abuse, revile, contemn Mn. Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. &amp;c. ; [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Lith">Lith.</a> <em>kussinu</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kutsana </dt>
           <dd><em>kutsana</em> n. abuse, reviling, reproach P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. Mn. iv, 163 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; reproachful or abusive expression P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 2-1, 53 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. an expression of contempt Nir. ii, 3</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kuts&#x0101; </dt>

           <dd><em>&#x25cb;sur&#x0101;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;ra</em> <em>&#x0101;s</em> m. pl. the Kuntis and the inhabitants of Sur&#x0101;sh&#x1e6d;ra, g. <em>k&#x0101;rtakaujap&#x00e2;di</em></dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kuntika </dt>
           <dd><em>kuntika</em> <em>&#x0101;s</em> m. pl., N. of a people VP</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; kunt&#x012b; </dt>
           <dd><em>kunt&#x012b;</em> f. N. of P&#x1e5b;ith&#x0101; (daughter of a Y&#x0101;dava prince named &#x015a;&#x016b;ra <em>or Vasu &#x1e25;ariv. 5255</em>, who gave her to his childless cousin Kunti or Kuntibhoja, by whom she was adopted </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; she afterwards became one of the wives of P&#x0101;&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;u </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; on one occasion before her marriage she paid such respect to the powerful sage Durv&#x0101;sas that he taught her an incantation or charm, by virtue of which she was to have a child by any god she liked to invoke </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; out of curiosity she invoked the Sun, by whom she had a child, cf. <em>kar&#x1e47;a</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; but the Sun afterwards restored to her her maidenhood: soon after his marriage P&#x0101;&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;u retired to the woods to indulge his passion for hunting </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; there he killed a male and female deer, who turned out to be a &#x1e5a;ishi and his wife in the form of these animals </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the sage cursed P&#x0101;&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;u and predicted that he would die in the embrace of one of his wives <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p291-2"></a>[Page 291, Column 2]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; hence P&#x0101;&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;u lived apart from Kunt&#x012b;, but with his approval she made use of her charm and had three sons, Yudhish&#x1e6d;hira, Bh&#x012b;ma, and Arjuna, by the three deities Dharma, V&#x0101;yu, and Indra respectively </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>m&#x0101;dr&#x012b;</em>) P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a R&#x0101;kshas&#x012b; Buddh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a river VP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the wife of a Br&#x0101;hman L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the plant Boswellia thurifera L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a fragrant resin (= <em>guggulu</em>) L</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kunt&#x012b;nandana </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;nandana</em> m. either of the three elder P&#x0101;&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;ava princes</dd>

           <dt>kunda </dt>

           <dd>&#x2022; the tree Capparis trifoliata (cf. <em>kum&#x0101;raka</em>) </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x012b;&#x0341;</em>), f. a young girl, one from ten to twelve years old, maiden, daughter AV. AitBr. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or (in the Tantras) any virgin up to the age of sixteen or before menstruation has commenced </dd>

           <dt>kuru </dt>
           <dd><em>k&#x00fa;ru</em> <em>avas</em> m. pl., N. of a people of India and of their country (situated near the country of the Pa&#x00f1;c&#x0101;las </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; hence often connected with Pa&#x00f1;c&#x0101;la or Pa&#x00f1;c&#x0101;la [see <em>kuru-pa&#x00f1;c&#x25cb;</em> below]: the <em>uttara-kurava&#x1e25;</em>, or <em>uttar&#x0101;&#x1e25; kurava&#x1e25;</em> are the northern Kurus, the most northerly of the four Mah&#x0101;-dviipas or principal divisions of the known world [distinguished from the <em>dak&#x1e63;i&#x1e47;&#x0101;&#x1e25; kurava&#x1e25;</em> or southern Kurus MBh. i, 4346], by other systems regarded as one of the nine divisions or Varshas of the same </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; it was probably a country beyond the most northern range of the Him&#x00e2;laya, often described as a country of everlasting happiness [AitBr. MBh. &amp;c.], and considered by some to be the ancient home of the &#x0100;ryan race) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>&#x1e5b;tvijas</em> (priests) Naigh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = <em>kart&#x0101;ras</em> ('doers', fr. &#x221a;1. <em>k&#x1e5b;</em>) Comm. on ChUp </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>us</em>), m. N. of the ancestor of the Kurus (son of Sa&#x1e43;vara&#x1e47;a and Tapat&#x012b;, daughter of the sun [MBh. i, 3738 ff. Hariv. 1799 &amp;c.] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Kuru is the ancestor of both P&#x0101;&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;u and Dh&#x1e5b;ita-r&#x0101;sh&#x1e6d;ra, though the patronymic derived from his name is usually applied only to the sons of the latter, the sons and descendants of the former being called P&#x0101;&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;avas) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a son of &#x0100;gn&#x012b;dhra and grandson of Priya-vrata VP. BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; boiled rice L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the plant Solanum Jacquini (= <em>ka&#x1e47;&#x1e6d;ak&#x0101;rik&#x0101;</em>) L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x016b;s</em>), f. a princess of the Kuru race P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 4-1, 66 &amp; 176 (cf. <em>kaurava</em>, &amp;c.)</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; kurukata </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;kata</em> m. N. of a man, g. <em>garg&#x00e2;di</em> and <em>anu&#x015b;atik&#x00e2;di</em></dd>

MBh. &amp;c.] or <em>buddhim</em> [Nal. xxvi, 10] or <em>matim</em> <em>&#x1e43;Bh. &#x1e5b;.</em> or <em>bh&#x0101;vam</em> <em>ib.</em>, &amp;c.) towards any object, turn the attention to, resolve upon, determine on (loc., dat., inf., or a sentence with <em>iti</em> e.g. <em>m&#x0101; &#x015b;oke mana&#x1e25; k&#x1e5b;th&#x0101;&#x1e25;</em>, do not turn your mind to grief Nal. xiv, 22 [301, 2] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>gaman&#x0101;ya mati&#x1e43; cakre</em>, he resolved upon going R. i, 9, 55 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>al&#x0101;bu&#x1e43; samutsra&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;u&#x1e43; mana&#x015b; cakre</em>, he resolved to create a gourd MBh. iii, 8844 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>dra&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;&#x0101; tav&#x00e2;sm&#x012b;7ti mati&#x1e43; cak&#x0101;ra</em>, he determined to see him MBh. iii, 12335) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to think of (acc.) R. i, 21, 14 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to make, render (with two acc., e.g. <em>&#x0101;ditya&#x1e43; k&#x0101;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;h&#x0101;m akurvata</em>, they made the sun their goal AitBr. iv, 7) RV. &#x015a;Br. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to procure for another, bestow, grant (with gen. or loc.) RV. VS. &#x015a;Br. &amp;c </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; to appoint, institute ChUp. Mn </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; to proceed, act, put in practice VS. &#x015a;Br. AitBr. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to worship, sacrifice RV. &#x015a;Br. Mn. iii, 210 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to make a sound (<em>svaram</em> or <em>&#x015b;abdam</em>) MBh. iii, 11718 P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 4-4, 34 Hit.), utter, pronounce (often ifc. with the sounds <em>pha&#x1e6d;</em>, <em>phut</em>, <em>bh&#x0101;&#x1e47;</em>, <em>v&#x00e1;&#x1e63;a&#x1e6d;</em>, <em>svadh&#x0101;&#x0341;</em>, <em>sv&#x0101;&#x0341;h&#x0101;</em>, <em>hi&#x1e43;</em>), pronounce any formula (Mn. ii, 74 and xi, 33) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with numeral adverbs ending in <em>dh&#x0101;</em>) to divide, separate or break up into parts (e.g. <em>dvidh&#x0101;-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em>, to divide into two parts, ind. p. <em>dvidh&#x0101; k&#x1e5b;tv&#x0101;</em> or <em>dvidh&#x0101;-k&#x1e5b;tya</em> or <em>-k&#x0101;ram</em> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 3-4, 62 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>sahasradh&#x0101;-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em>, to break into a thousand pieces) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with adverbs ending in <em>vat</em>) to make like or similar, consider equivalent (e.g. <em>r&#x0101;jya&#x1e43; t&#x1e5b;&#x1e47;a-vat k&#x1e5b;tv&#x0101;</em>, valuing the kingdom like a straw Vet.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with adverbs ending in <em>s&#x0101;t</em>) to reduce anything to, cause to become, make subject ( <em>&#x0101;tma-s&#x0101;t</em>, <em>bhasma-s&#x0101;t</em>) P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 5-4, 52ff. The above senses of &#x221a;<em>k&#x1e5b;</em> may be variously modified or almost infinitely extended according to the noun with which this &#x221a;is connected, as in the following examples: <em>sakhya&#x1e43;-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em>, to contract friendship with </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>p&#x016b;j&#x0101;&#x1e43;-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em>, to honour </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>r&#x0101;jya&#x1e43;-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em>, to reign </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>sneha&#x1e43;-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em>, to show affection </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x0101;j&#x00f1;&#x0101;&#x1e43;</em> or <em>nide&#x015b;a&#x1e43;</em> or <em>&#x015b;&#x0101;sana&#x1e43;</em> or <em>k&#x0101;ma&#x1e43;</em> or <em>y&#x0101;can&#x0101;&#x1e43;</em> or <em>vaca&#x1e25;</em> or <em>vacana&#x1e43;</em> or <em>v&#x0101;kya&#x1e43;-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em>, to perform any one's command or wish or request &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>dharma&#x1e43;-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em>, to do one's duty Mn. vii, 136 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>nakh&#x0101;ni-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em>, 'to clean one's nails', <em>k&#x1e5b;ta-nakha</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>udaka&#x1e43;</em> <em>&#x1e43;n. Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. &#x1e5b;. &#x1e0d;a&#x015b;.</em> or <em>salila&#x1e43;</em> [R. i, 44, 49] &#x221a;<em>k&#x1e5b;</em>, to offer a libation of Water to the dead </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to perform ablutions </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>astr&#x0101;&#x1e47;i-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em>, to practise the use of weapons MBh. iii, 11824 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>dardura&#x1e43;-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em>, to breathe the flute P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 4-4, 34 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>da&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;a&#x1e43;-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em>, to inflict punishment &amp;c. Vet </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>k&#x0101;la&#x1e43;-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em>, to bring one's time to an end, i.e. to die </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>cira&#x1e43;-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em>, to be long in doing anything, delay </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>manas&#x0101;</em> (for <em>&#x25cb;si</em>, above) &#x221a;<em>k&#x1e5b;</em>, to place in one's mind, think of, meditate MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x015b;iras&#x0101;-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em>, to place on one's the head </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>m&#x016b;rdhn&#x0101;-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em>, to place on one's head, obey, honour. Very rarely in Veda (AV. xviii, 2, 27), but commonly in the Br&#x0101;hma&#x1e47;as, S&#x016b;tras, and especially in classical Sansk&#x1e5b;it the perf. forms <em>cak&#x0101;ra</em> and <em>cakre</em> auxiliarily used to form the periphrastical perfect of verbs, especially of causatives, e.g. <em>&#x0101;s&#x0101;&#x1e43; cakre</em>, 'he sat down' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>gamay&#x0101;&#x0341;&#x1e43; cak&#x0101;ra</em>, 'he caused to go' [see P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 3-1, 40 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in Veda some other forms of &#x221a;<em>k&#x1e5b;</em> are used in a similar way, viz. pr. <em>karoti</em> &#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;kh&#x015a;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; impf. <em>akar</em> MaitrS. and K&#x0101;&#x1e6d;h </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 3. pl. <em>akran</em> MaitrS. and TBr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Prec. <em>kriy&#x0101;t</em> MaitrS. ( P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 3-1, 42) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; according to P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 3-1, 41, also <em>karotu</em> with &#x221a;<em>vid</em>]. Caus. <em>k&#x0101;rayati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em>, to cause to act or do, cause another to perform, have anything made or done by another (double acc., instr. and acc. [see P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-4, 53], e.g. <em>sabh&#x0101;&#x1e43; k&#x0101;ritav&#x0101;n</em>, he caused an assembly to be made Hit </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>r&#x0101;ja-dar&#x015b;ana&#x1e43; m&#x0101;&#x1e43; k&#x0101;raya</em>, cause me to have an audience of the king </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>v&#x0101;&#x1e47;ijya&#x1e43; k&#x0101;rayed vai&#x015b;yam</em>, he ought to cause the Vai&#x015b;ya to engage in trade Mn. viii, 410 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>na &#x015b;ak&#x1e63;y&#x0101;mi ki&#x1e43;cit k&#x0101;rayitu&#x1e43; tvay&#x0101;</em>, I shall not be able to have anything done by thee MBh. ii, 6) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to cause to manufacture or form or cultivate L&#x0101;&#x1e6d;y. Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. ii, 158 MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to cause to place or put, have anything placed, put upon, &amp;c. (e.g. <em>ta&#x1e43; citrapa&#x1e6d;a&#x1e43; v&#x0101;sa-g&#x1e5b;he bhitt&#x0101;v ak&#x0101;rayat</em>, he had the picture placed on the wall in his house Kath&#x0101;s. v, 30) Mn. viii, 251. Sometimes the Caus. of &#x221a;<em>k&#x1e5b;</em> is used for the simple verb or without a causal signification (e.g. <em>pada&#x1e43; k&#x0101;rayati</em>, he pronounces a word P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-3, 71 K&#x0101;&#x015b;. [301, 3] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>mithy&#x0101; k&#x25cb;</em>, he pronounces wrongly ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kaikey&#x012b;m anu r&#x0101;j&#x0101;na&#x1e43; k&#x0101;raya</em>, treat or deal with Kaikey&#x012b; as the king does R. ii, 58, 16): Desid. <em>c&#x00ed;k&#x012b;r&#x1e63;ati</em> (aor. 2. sg. <em>acik&#x012b;r&#x1e63;&#x012b;s</em> &#x015a;Br. iii), ep. also <em>&#x25cb;te</em>, to wish to make or do, intend to do, design, intend, begin, strive after AV. xii, 4, 19 &#x015a;Br. K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r. Mn. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to wish to sacrifice or worship AV. v, 8, 3: Intens. 3. pl. <em>karikrati</em> (pr. p. <em>k&#x00e1;rikrat</em>, Naigh. ii, 1 and P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 7-4, 65), to do repeatedly RV. AV. TS </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Class. <em>carkarti</em> or <em>carikarti</em> or <em>car&#x012b;karti</em> [P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 7-4, 92 K&#x0101;&#x015b;.], also <em>carkar&#x012b;ti</em> or <em>carikar&#x012b;ti</em> or <em>car&#x012b;kar&#x012b;ti</em> or <em>cekr&#x012b;yate</em> <em>ib. &#x1e63;ch. Vop.</em> ; [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hib">Hib.</a> <em>caraim</em>, 'I perform, execute' ; <em>ceard</em>, 'an art, trade, business, function' ; <em>sucridh</em>, 'easy' ; Old Germ. <em>karawan</em>, 'to prepare' ; Mod. Germ. <em>gar</em>, 'prepared (as food)' ; Lat. <em>creo</em>, <em>ceremonia</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ?.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; k&#x1e5b;t 1</dt>

           <dd>&#x2022; it was originally an acc. pl. fr. <em>k&#x1e5b;tu</em>, formed by the affix <em>tu</em> fr. &#x221a;1. <em>k&#x1e5b;</em> (cf. also <em>k&#x1e5b;t</em> in <em>sak&#x1e5b;&#x0301;t</em>.)</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; k&#x1e5b;pa </dt>
           <dd><em>k&#x1e5b;&#x0301;pa</em> m. N. of a man (described as a friend of Indra) RV. viii, 3, 12 and 4, 2 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. and (<em>&#x012b;</em>), f. N. of the son and daughter of the sage &#x015a;aradvat (who performed severe penance </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the jealous Indra therefore sent a nymph to tempt him, but without success </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; however, twin sons were born to the sage in a clump of grass [<em>&#x015b;ara-stambe</em>], who were found by king &#x015a;&#x0101;ntanu and out of pity [<em>k&#x1e5b;p&#x0101;</em>] taken home and reared </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the daughter, K&#x1e5b;ip&#x012b;, married Dro&#x1e47;a, and had by him a son called A&#x015b;vatth&#x0101;man </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the son, K&#x1e5b;ipa, became one of the council at Hastin&#x0101;pura, and is sometimes called Gautama, sometimes &#x015a;&#x0101;radvata </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; according to Hariv. and VP., K&#x1e5b;ipa and K&#x1e5b;ip&#x012b; were only distant descendants of &#x015a;aradvat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; according to others, K&#x1e5b;ipa = Vy&#x0101;sa or = a son of K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a) MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. s.v. below</dd>

           <dd><em>k&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;&#x00ed;</em> <em>ayas</em> f. pl. (once only sg. RV. iv, 42, 1) men, races of men (sometimes with the epithet <em>m&#x0101;&#x0341;nu&#x1e63;&#x012b;s</em> [i, 59, 5 and vi, 18, 2] or <em>n&#x0101;&#x0341;hu&#x1e63;&#x012b;s</em> [vi, 46, 7] or <em>m&#x0101;navii&#x0341;s</em> [AV. iii, 24, 3] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>car&#x1e63;a&#x1e47;&#x00ed;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; originally the word may have meant cultivated ground, then an inhabited land, next its inhabitants, and lastly any race of men </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Indra and Agni have the N. <em>r&#x0101;&#x0341;j&#x0101;</em> or <em>p&#x00e1;ti&#x1e25; k&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;&#x012b;n&#x0101;&#x0341;m</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the term <em>p&#x00e1;&#x00f1;ca k&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;&#x00e1;yas</em>, perhaps originally designating the five &#x0100;ryan tribes of the Yadus, Turva&#x015b;as, Druhyus, Anus, and P&#x016b;rus, comprehends the whole human race, not only the &#x0100;ryan tribes) RV. AV </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>is</em>), f. ploughing, cultivating the soil L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; attracting, drawing L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 'harvest', the consequences (<em>karma-k&#x25cb;</em>) Naish. vi, 100 </dd>

           <dd><em>k&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;kara</em> m. N. of &#x015a;iva L</dd>

           <dt>k&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;&#x1e47;a 1</dt>
           <dd><em>k&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;&#x1e47;&#x00e1;</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;&#x0341;</em>)n. black, dark, dark-blue (opposed to <em>&#x015b;vet&#x00e1;</em>, <em>&#x015b;ukl&#x00e1;</em>, <em>r&#x00f3;hita</em>, and <em>aru&#x1e47;&#x00e1;</em>) RV. AV. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; wicked, evil Vop. vii, 82 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. (with or without <em>pak&#x1e63;a</em>) the dark half of the lunar month from full to new moon Mn. Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. Bhag. Su&#x015b;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the fourth or Kali-yuga L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>k&#x1e5b;&#x0301;&#x1e63;&#x1e47;as</em>), m. black (the colour) or dark-blue (which is often confounded with black by the Hind&#x016b;s) L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the antelope RV. x, 94, 5 VS. TS. &#x015a;Br. BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a kind of animal feeding on carrion AV. xi, 2, 2 (<em>k&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;&#x1e47;&#x00e1;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the Indian cuckoo or Kokila (cf. R. ii, 52, 2) L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a crow L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Carissa Carandas L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of one of the poets of the RV. (descended from A&#x1e45;giras) RV. viii, 85, 3 and 4 &#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;khBr. xxx, 9 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (a son of Devak&#x012b; and pupil of Ghora &#x0100;&#x1e45;girasa) ChUp. iii, 17, 6 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a celebrated Avat&#x0101;r of the god Vish&#x1e47;u, or sometimes identified with Vish&#x1e47;u himself [MBh. v, 2563 ; xiv, 1589 ff. Hariv. 2359 &amp;c.] as distinct from his ten Avat&#x0101;rs or incarnations (in the earlier legends he appears as a great hero and teacher <em>&#x1e43;Bh. Bhag.</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in the more recent he is deified, and is often represented as a young and amorous shepherd with flowing hair and a flute in his hand </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the following are a few particulars of his birth and history as related in Hariv. 3304 ff. and in the Pur&#x0101;&#x1e47;as &amp;c.: Vasu-deva, who was a descendant of Yadu and Yay&#x0101;ti, had two wives, Rohi&#x1e47;&#x012b; and Devak&#x012b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the latter had eight sons of whom the eighth was K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Ka&#x1e43;sa, king of Mathur&#x0101; and cousin of Devak&#x012b;, was informed by a prediction that one of these sons would kill him </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; he therefore kept Vasu-deva and his wife in confinement, and slew their first six children </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the seventh was Balar&#x0101;ma who was saved by being abstracted from the womb of Devak&#x012b; and transferred to that of Rohi&#x1e47;&#x012b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the eighth was K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a who was born with black skin and a peculiar mark on his breast </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; his father Vasu-deva managed to escape from Mathur&#x0101; with the child, and favoured by the gods found a herdsman named Nanda whose wife Ya&#x015b;o-d&#x0101; had just been delivered of a son which Vasu-deva conveyed to Devak&#x012b; after substituting his own in its place. Nanda with his wife Ya&#x015b;o-d&#x0101; took the infant K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a and settled first in Gokula or Vraja, and afterwards in V&#x1e5b;ind&#x0101;vana, where K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a and Bala-r&#x0101;ma grew up together, roaming in the woods and joining in the sports of the herdsmen's sons <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p306-3"></a>[Page 306, Column 3]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a as a youth contested the sovereignty of Indra, and was victorious over that god, who descended from heaven to praise K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a, and made him lord over the cattle [Hariv. 3787 ff. ; 7456 ff. VP.] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a is described as sporting constantly with the Gop&#x012b;s or shepherdesses [Hariv. 4078 ff. ; 8301 ff. VP. G&#x012b;t.] of whom a thousand became his wives, though only eight are specified, R&#x0101;dh&#x0101; being the favourite [Hariv. 6694 ff. ; 9177 ff. VP.] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a built and fortified a city called Dv&#x0101;rak&#x0101; in Gujar&#x0101;t, and thither transported the inhabitants of Mathur&#x0101; after killing Ka&#x1e43;sa </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a had various wives besides the Gop&#x012b;s, and by Rukmi&#x1e47;&#x012b; had a son Pradyumna who is usually identified with K&#x0101;ma-deva </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with Jains, K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a is one of the nine black Vasu-devas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with Buddhists he is the chief of the black demons, who are the enemies of Buddha and the white demons) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of an attendant in Skanda's retinue MBh. ix, 2559 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of an Asura Hariv. 12936 S&#x0101;y. on RV. i, 101, 1 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a king of the N&#x0101;gas MBh. ii, 360 Divy&#x00e2;v. ii </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of Arjuna (the most renowned of the P&#x0101;&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;u princes, so named apparently from his colour as a child) MBh. iv, 1389 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of Vy&#x0101;sa MBh. Hariv. 11089 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of H&#x0101;rita, <em>-h&#x0101;rita</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a son of &#x015a;uka by P&#x012b;var&#x012b; (teacher of the Yoga) Hariv. 980 ff </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a pupil of Bharad-v&#x0101;ja Kath&#x0101;s. vii, 15 </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; N. of a hell VP </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; &#x0100;. to undertake, strive after, make effort for (dat.) P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-3, 38 ; iii, 1, 14 K&#x0101;&#x015b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (loc.) Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;. xv, 20 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; &#x0100;. (P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-. 3, 38) to proceed well, advance, make progress, gain a footing, succeed, have effect MBh. R. Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be appliable or practicable Sarvad </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; P. to be liable to the peculiar arrangement of a Vedic text called Krama (i.e. to be doubled, as a letter or word) RPr&#x0101;t. vi, 4 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; &#x0100;. to read according to the Krama arrangement of a Vedic text RPr&#x0101;t. L&#x0101;&#x1e6d;y. (<em>a-kr&#x0101;nta</em>): Caus. P. <em>kramayati</em>, to cause to step &#x015a;Br. v </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; xi </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kramayati</em> or <em>kr&#x0101;m&#x25cb;</em>, to make liable to the peculiar arrangement called Krama (i.e. to double a letter or word) RPr&#x0101;t. &amp;c.: Intens. <em>ca&#x1e45;kramyate</em> (P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 3-1, 23 K&#x0101;&#x015b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; p. <em>ca&#x1e45;-kramy&#x00e1;m&#x0101;&#x1e47;a</em> [TS. vii, 1, 19, 3 MBh.] or &#x25cb;kramam&#x25cb; MBh. i, 7919 and BhP. v, 6, 7) or <em>ca&#x1e45;kram&#x012b;ti</em> (MBh. xiv, 137 and 141 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; impf. 2. pl. <em>ca&#x1e45;kramata</em> RV. viii, 55, 4 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. p. <em>ca&#x1e45;krami&#x1e63;y&#x00e1;t</em> TS. vii, 1, 19, 3 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ind. p. <em>&#x25cb;mitv&#x0101;</em> Vop. v, 3 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>&#x25cb;mit&#x00e1;</em>), to step to and fro, walk or wander about</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; krama </dt>
           <dd><em>kr&#x00e1;ma</em> m. a step AV. x, 5, 25 ff. TS. iii MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; going, proceeding, course (cf. <em>k&#x0101;la-k&#x25cb;</em>) M&#x1e5b;icch. Pa&#x00f1;cat. M&#x0101;lat&#x012b;m. Hit </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the way R. ii, 25, 2 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a position taken (by an animal &amp;c.) before making a spring or attacking Pa&#x00f1;cat. Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;. ii, 9 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the foot MBh. iii, 14316 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; uninterrupted or regular progress, order, series, regular arrangement, succession (e.g. <em>var&#x1e47;a-krame&#x1e47;a</em>, 'in the order of the castes' Mn. viii, 24 and ix, 85) AV. viii, 9, 10 RPr&#x0101;t. xv, 5 K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r. R. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; hereditary descent Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. ii, 119 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; method, manner (e.g. <em>yena krame&#x1e47;a</em>, in which manner R. ii, 26, 20 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>tad-anusara&#x1e47;a-krame&#x1e47;a</em>, so as to go on following him Hit.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; diet Car. vi, 13 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; custom, rule sanctioned by tradition M&#x0101;rkP. xxiii, 112 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>krama&#x1e43;</em> &#x221a;1. <em>k&#x1e5b;</em>, 'to follow that rule') Ny&#x0101;yam </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; occasion, cause (with gen. or ifc.) Kath&#x0101;s. xviii, 380 Hit </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 'progressing step by step', a peculiar manner or method of reading and writing Vedic texts (so called because the reading proceeds from the 1st member, either word or letter, to the 2nd, then the 2nd is repeated and connected with the 3rd, the 3rd repeated and connected with the 4 h, and so on </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; this manner of reading in relation to words is called <em>pada-</em> [TPr&#x0101;t. ii, 12], in relation to conjunct consonants <em>var&#x1e47;a-</em> <em>ib.</em>) Pr&#x0101;t </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the words or letters themselves when combined or arranged in the said manner ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in dram.) attainment of the object desired (or accord. to others 'noticing of any one's affection') Da&#x015b;ar. i, 36 f. S&#x0101;h. Prat&#x0101;par </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in rhet.) a kind of simile (in which the comparisons exhibited correspond to each other in regular succession) V&#x0101;m. iv, 3, 17 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; power, strength L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>e&#x1e47;a</em>, <em>&#x0101;t</em>), instr. abl. ind. in regular course, gradually, by degrees R. Pa&#x00f1;cat. Ragh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; according to order or rank or series Mn. Ragh. &amp;c</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; perf. <em>cukrodha</em> &#x015a;Br. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. 2nd <em>krotsyati</em> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 8-2, 37 K&#x0101;&#x015b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. 1st <em>kroddh&#x0101;</em> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 7-2, 10 Siddh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. Subj. 2. sg. <em>krudhas</em> AV. MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inf. <em>kroddhum</em> Nal.), to become angry, be wrathful or angry with (dat. [P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-4, 37] or gen.), on account of (loc.): Caus. <em>krodh&#x00e1;yati</em> (aor. <em>&#x00e1;cukrudhat</em> RV. v, 34, 7 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Subj. 1. sg. <em>cukrudham</em>, 1. pl. <em>&#x25cb;dh&#x0101;ma</em>), to make angry, provoke, irritate RV. AV. R. (inf. <em>krodhayitum</em>) ; [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Lith">Lith.</a> <em>rus-tus</em>, 'angry' ; <em>rus-tyb&#x00ea;</em> 'anger' ; Gk. ? Germ.            <dt>kr&#x016b;ra </dt>
           <dd><em>kr&#x016b;r&#x00e1;</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;&#x0341;</em>)n. (fr. <em>krav&#x00ed;-s</em>, cf. <em>sth&#x016b;r&#x00e1;</em> and <em>sth&#x00e1;vira</em>), wounded, hurt, sore &#x015a;Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 'bloody, raw', cruel, fierce, ferocious, pitiless, harsh, formidable AV. TS. vi Mn. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inauspicious (as opposed to <em>saumya</em> and <em>a-kr&#x016b;ra</em>, said of the first, third, fifth, seventh, ninth, and eleventh signs of the zodiac, which are supposed to have a malignant influence Jyot </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; said of planets VarB&#x1e5b;S.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; hard, solid Su&#x015b;r. &#x015a;ak. Pa&#x00f1;cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; strong (as a bow, opposed to <em>manda</em>) N&#x0101;r </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; hot, sharp, disagreeable L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>am</em>), ind. in a formidable manner MBh. iii, 15669 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>as</em>, <em>am</em>), m. n. boiled rice (cf. <em>k&#x016b;ra</em>) L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. a hawk L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a heron L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; red oleander (= <em>rakta-karaviira</em>) L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. a variety of Punarnav&#x0101; with red blossoms L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x00e1;m</em>), n. a wound, sore AV. VS. TS. &#x015a;Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; blood-shedding, slaughter, cruelty, any horrible deed, harshness AV. AitBr. i, 26 Mn. i, 29 &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; any frightful apparition AdbhBr </dd>

           <dd><em>kl&#x00f3;&#x015b;a</em> m. (= <em>kr&#x00f3;&#x015b;a</em>) calling out to ['fear' S&#x0101;y.] RV. vi, 46, 14</dd>

           <dt>kva </dt>
           <dd><em>kv&#x00e1;</em> ind. (fr. 1. <em>ku</em> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 5-3, 12 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; V&#x012b;, 2, 105), loc. of 2. <em>k&#x00e1;</em> = <em>kasmin</em>, or <em>katarasmin</em> Mn. x, 66 (<em>kva &#x015b;reyas-tvam</em>, in whom is the preference?) Kath&#x0101;s. lxxxiii, 36 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; where? in what place? whither? RV. (sometimes connected with particles <em>&#x00e1;ha</em>, <em>&#x00ed;d</em>, <em>iva</em>, <em>sv&#x00ed;d</em>) &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (connected with <em>nu</em>) Nal. M&#x0101;lav </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with <em>nu khalu</em>) &#x015a;ak </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with &#x221a;<em>bh&#x016b;</em>, <em>&#x221a;as</em>) how is it with? what has become of? i.e. it is done with RV. i, 161, 4 ; vii, 88, 5 AV. x, 8, 7 &#x015a;Br. P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 3-1, 12 V&#x0101;rtt. 1 Pat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with <em>gata</em>) how is it with? Nal. Da&#x015b;. (<em>kva gatas tava mayy anur&#x0101;ga&#x1e25;</em>, what has become of your affection for me ?) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or <em>kva</em> alone may have the same meaning (e. g. <em>kva sukham</em>, where is happiness? i.e. there is no such thing as happiness, S&#x0101;ntis.) Pa&#x00f1;cat. Naish. i, 20 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (after a negative phrase) how much less? R. i, 67, 10 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kva</em> - <em>kva</em> or <em>kutra-kva</em> (implying excessive incongruity) where is this? where is that? how distant is this from that? how little does this agree with that? (e.g. <em>kva s&#x016b;rya-prabhavo va&#x1e43;&#x015b;a&#x1e25; kva c&#x00e2;lpa-vi&#x1e63;ay&#x0101; mati&#x1e25;</em>, how can my limited intellect describe the solar race? Ragh. i, 2) MBh. R. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kv&#x00e2;pi</em>, anywhere, somewhere, to some place, in a certain place Nal. Pa&#x00f1;cat. Kath&#x0101;s </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sometimes S&#x0101;h. Hit </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>na kva ca</em>, nowhere, never BhP. iv, 29, 64 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>na kva cana</em>, nowhere MBh. xiv, 560 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kva cid</em> = <em>kasmini&#x015b;-cid</em> Pa&#x00f1;cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; anywhere, somewhere, to any place, in a certain place Mn. R. &#x015a;ak. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in a certain case, at some time, once upon a time Nal. Pa&#x00f1;cat. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sometimes Comm </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kvacid-kvacid</em>, here - there, here and there, in various places MBh. i </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; now - then, now and then R. iii, 50, 7 Bhart&#x1e5b;. i, 4 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>na kvacid</em>, nowhere, never, by no means Mn. Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. Nal. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kvacid api na</em> id. Megh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>yatra kv&#x00e2;pi</em>, wherever, in whatsoever place Bhart&#x1e5b;. iii, 91 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>y&#x00e1;tra kv&#x00e1;-ca</em> id. &#x015a;Br. ChUp. L&#x0101;&#x1e6d;y. BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>yatra kva-cana</em>, in or to whatsoever place </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in any case or matter whatever Mn. ix, 233 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; whenever BhP. v, 21, 9 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>yatra kva v&#x00e2;tha</em> - <em>tatra tatr&#x00e2;pi</em>, wherever-there BhP. i, 17, 36</dd>

           <dt>kva&#x1e47; </dt>
           <dd><em>kva&#x1e47;</em> cl. 1. P. <em>kva&#x1e47;ati</em> (pr. p. <em>kva&#x1e47;at</em>), to sound, make any sound, tinkle Amar. Kath&#x0101;s. lxxxv, 25 Hit </dd>

           <dt>k&#x1e63;atra </dt>
           <dd><em>k&#x1e63;atr&#x00e1;</em> n. (&#x221a;1. <em>k&#x1e63;i</em>? </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; g. <em>ardharc&#x00e2;di</em>) sg. and pl. dominion, supremacy, power, might (whether human or supernatural, especially applied to the power of Varu&#x1e47;a-Mitra and Indra) RV. AV. VS. &#x015a;Br. ii </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; xi </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sg. and pl. government, governing body RV. AV. VS. x, 17 TBr. ii </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the military or reigning order (the members of which in the earliest times, as represented by the Vedic hymns, were generally called R&#x0101;janya, not Kshatriya </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; afterwards, when the difference between Brahman and Kshatra or the priestly and civil authorities became more distinct, applied to the second or reigning or military caste) VS. AV. TS. &amp;c. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p325-2"></a>[Page 325, Column 2]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a member of the military or second order or caste, warrior Mn. MBh. &amp;c. (fancifully derived fr. <em>k&#x1e63;at&#x0101;t tra</em> fr. &#x221a;<em>trai</em> i.e. 'a preserver from injury' Ragh. ii, 53) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the rank of a member of the reigning or military order, authority of the second caste AitBr. viii, 5 &#x015a;Br. xiii, 1, 5, 2 BhP. iii, ix </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; wealth Naigh. ii, 10 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; water, i, 12 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the body L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Tabernaemontana coronaria (v. l. <em>chattra</em>) L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x012b;</em>), f. a woman of the second caste L</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; fut. 2nd <em>k&#x1e63;a&#x1e43;syate</em>, <em>&#x25cb;ti</em>, <em>k&#x1e63;ami&#x1e63;yati</em> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; to submit to (dat.) &#x015a;Br. iii </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; (perf. <em>k&#x1e63;amay&#x0101;m &#x0101;sa</em>) to suffer or bear patiently R. v, 49, 11 (cf. <em>k&#x1e63;am&#x0101;paya</em>) ; [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Goth">Goth.</a> <em>hramja</em> (?) Angl. Sax. <em>hremman</em>, 'to hinder, disquiet.']</dd>

           <dt>k&#x1e63;etra </dt>
           <dd><em>k&#x1e63;&#x00e9;tra</em> n. (&#x221a;2. <em>k&#x1e63;i</em>) landed property, land, soil (<em>k&#x1e63;&#x00e9;trasya p&#x00e1;ti</em>, 'lord of the soil', N. of a kind of tutelary deity RV. AV. ii, 8, 5 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also <em>k&#x1e63;&#x00e9;trasya p&#x00e1;tn&#x012b;</em>, 'mistress of the soil', and <em>k&#x1e63;&#x00e9;tr&#x0101;&#x1e47;&#x0101;m p&#x00e1;ti</em>, 'the lord of the soil', N. of tutelary deities AV. ii, 12, 1 VS. xvi, 18) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 'soil of merit', a Buddha or any holy person Divy&#x00e2;v </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; often ifc.) BrahmaP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an enclosed plot of ground, portion of space, superficies (e.g. <em>sv-alpa-k&#x1e63;&#x25cb;</em>, of a small circuit Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. ii, 156) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in geom.) a plane figure (as a triangle, circle, &amp;c.) enclosed by lines, any figure considered as having geometrical dimensions Gol </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a diagram W </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; an astrological mansion VarB&#x1e5b;S. VarB&#x1e5b;. i, xi </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in chiromancy) certain portions marked out on the palm VarB&#x1e5b;S. lxviii, 1 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 'fertile soil', the fertile womb, wife Mn. Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. ii, 127 MBh. R. &#x015a;ak. BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the body (considered as the field of the indwelling soul) Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;. iii, 178 Bhag. xiii, 1 and 2 Kum. vi, 77 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in S&#x0101;&#x1e43;khya phil.) = <em>a-vyakta</em> (q.v.) Tattvas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x012b;&#x0341;</em>) f. only dat. <em>&#x25cb;triya&#x00ed;</em> for <em>&#x25cb;triy&#x0101;&#x0341;t</em> (AV. ii, 10, 1) TBr. ii, 5, 6, 1 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; [cf. <em>&#x00e1;-k&#x1e63;&#x25cb;</em>, <em>anya-</em> and <em>kuru-k&#x1e63;etr&#x00e1;</em>, <em>karma-k&#x1e63;&#x25cb;</em>, <em>deva-k&#x1e63;&#x25cb;</em>, <em>dharma-k&#x1e63;&#x25cb;</em>, <em>ra&#x1e47;a-k&#x1e63;&#x25cb;</em>, <em>siddha-k&#x1e63;&#x25cb;</em>, <em>su-k&#x1e63;&#x25cb;</em>, <em>sur&#x00ea;&#x015b;var&#x012b;-k&#x1e63;&#x25cb;</em> ; cf. also Goth. <em>haithi</em>, Them. <em>haithjo</em> ; Germ. <em>&#x1e25;eide</em>.]</dd>
